Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.

Title: Data Scientist - Production
Description:
Level: Manager:

Experience: 4+ years

Role Overview: The Data Scientist - Production ensures the efficient transition of machine learning models from exploration to production. Working closely with the UDP team, this role is responsible for deploying, maintaining, and evolving AI models, ensuring their reliability and scalability in production environments. The role also includes representing CCEP in third-party projects to ensure smooth handovers.

Key Responsibilities:


Deploy and maintain AI models in production, ensuring efficient refreshes as needed.
Collaborate with the UDP team to integrate machine learning solutions into production workflows.
Represent CCEP in third-party projects, ensuring smooth transitions post-handover.
Monitor model performance and address requests for maintenance and evolution.
Implement best practices in MLOps for scalable and reliable model deployment.


Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience in deploying and maintaining machine learning models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and cloud platforms (e.g., Databricks, Azure).
Strong understanding of MLOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and model monitoring.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are:

At Taptap, we are not just shaping the future of advertising technology‚Äîwe are building it today. Guided by teamwork, respect, and determination, we challenge the status quo, connect ideas with impact, and create innovative solutions that drive real results. Our culture thrives on visionary thinking, collaboration, and a deep respect for people‚Äîbecause good people, doing great things is what makes us stronger.

As a global team, we believe in pushing boundaries, fostering growth, and exceeding expectations. We are authentic, ambitious, and passionate about what we do, and we never settle for less than excellence. If you‚Äôre looking to be part of a company that values creativity, problem-solving, and the power of technology, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Short Job Description:

We are seeking a talented and experienced Data Scientist to join our dynamic team in the exciting world of digital marketing. You'll be instrumental in leveraging data to drive strategic decisions, optimize campaigns, and build innovative solutions within an Agile Scrum environment.

What You'll Do:

As a Data Scientist, you'll be at the forefront of transforming complex data into actionable insights. Your responsibilities will include:



Designing and implementing machine learning models for various applications, including estimation, prediction, and optimization within programmatic advertising.
Performing extensive data processing and analysis, including working with large datasets (big data) from various sources.
Managing and querying both relational (PostgreSQL) and non-relational databases (e.g. mongo).
Working with geospatial data, extracting insights and developing solutions based on location-specific information.
Collaborating closely with product owners, engineers, and other stakeholders in an Agile Scrum methodology to deliver impactful data products.
Utilizing AWS services such as S3, EC2, Athena, and EMR for data storage, processing, and analysis.
Managing code and collaborating with the team using Git and the Atlassian suite (Jira, Bitbucket, Confluence).



What We're Looking For:



2-3 years of professional experience as a Data Scientist. While prior experience in advertising is a plus, it's not strictly required.
A strong foundation in mathematics and statistics, demonstrated by a degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Proficiency in Python for data manipulation, analysis, and model development.
Solid experience with SQL, particularly PostgreSQL.
Familiarity with Git for version control.
Hands-on experience with AWS services (S3, EC2, Athena, EMR).
Experience working within an Agile Scrum framework.
A proven ability to work with large and complex datasets.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a strong analytical mindset.
While 2-3 years of data science experience is key, we value candidates with 5+ years of overall professional work experience.



Bonus Points For:



Experience in the digital advertising or ad-tech industry.
Familiarity with other big data technologies.



If you're a passionate Data Scientist eager to make a significant impact in a fast-paced and data-driven industry, we encourage you to apply!

Benefits:



A dynamic and collaborative work environment.
Competitive compensation package aligned with experience and profile.
Permanent position with strong opportunities for internal growth within an international company.
Role based in our Madrid, Spain office.



Join Us!

At Taptap, diversity and inclusion are at the heart of who we are. We believe that different perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences fuel innovation and success. We are team players who won‚Äôt go solo, thoughtful collaborators who value others‚Äô ideas, and ambitious professionals who refuse to accept the status quo.

If you are ready to make things happen and be part of a company that is creating tomorrow, today, apply now and help us build the future of advertising

Title: Data Scientist (f/m/x)
Description:

Se valorar√° positivamente la experiencia previa en gesti√≥n y liderazgo de equipos, as√≠ como la experiencia y el conocimiento del sector bancario.



Bienestar y Beneficios


Equilibrio mental y emocional: Te apoyamos en los momentos dif√≠ciles de la vida, ayud√°ndote a manejar crisis, enfermedades y mantener una buena salud mental. Contamos con iniciativas como asesoramiento profesional, apoyo emocional, y una cultura organizacional abierta donde puedes hablar libremente sobre salud mental.
Bienestar f√≠sico: Cuidamos tu salud f√≠sica ofreci√©ndote medidas preventivas y un entorno laboral que fomente tu bienestar. Esto incluye descuentos en gimnasios, chequeos m√©dicos anuales o escritorios ergon√≥micos, entre otros beneficios.
Conexi√≥n social: Creemos firmemente en la colaboraci√≥n, la inclusi√≥n y el sentido de pertenencia como pilares del bienestar. Fomentamos nuevas perspectivas, la confianza y la cohesi√≥n de equipo con elementos como permisos remunerados y no remunerados, modelo h√≠brido de trabajo (seg√∫n e rol), etc.
Seguridad financiera: Te apoyamos para que alcances tus metas financieras tanto en tu vida laboral actual, como en el futuro. Benef√≠ciate de ayuda alimentaria, aportaciones a fondos de pensiones, servicios bancarios para empleados, programa de compensaci√≥n flexible‚Ä¶



Join one of Europe's leading banks.

Be part of a highly dynamic, multidisciplinary team committed to putting our clients at the heart of our business and helping drive a data-driven culture across the organization.

Responsibilities


Analysis of customer data (transactional, socio-demographic, behavioral, products and service consumption) for the identification of business opportunities.
Development and maintenance of machine learning models for the analysis of main business objectives: cross-selling, upselling, churning, client satisfaction, products recommendation.
Support in the development of multichannel campaigns, events-based marketing, real time decisioning. - Active participation in the development and maintenance of periodic business reports.
Maintain a close collaboration with other business units for ensuring the alignment with main



Skills


Bachelor degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, Data Sciences, Economics, Finance or related field.
3-5 years of experience as Data Scientist in a similar position.
Excellent programming skills: Python, R, SAS, SQL, etc.
High level of English and good communication skills
Previous experience in managing and leading teams, as well as previous experience and knowledge of the banking sector, will be positively valued.



Well-being & Benefits


Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health‚Ä¶.
Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. For example, health care offerings, gyms and healthier ways of working, check up's, standing desks,...
Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being. Benefits vary from different types of paid and unpaid leave, career coaching, flexible working time models, participation in our ERGs,...
Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from pension contribution plans, banking services for employees, insurance, company bicycles or public transport perks,...



We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

  • 3-5 years of experience as Data Scientist in a similar position.
  • Excellent programming skills: Python, R, SAS, SQL, etc.
  • High level of English and good communication skills
  • Previous experience in managing and leading teams, as well as previous experience and knowledge of the banking sector, will be positively valued.


Well-being & Benefits

  • Emotionally and mentally balanced: We support you in dealing with life crises, maintaining stability through illness, and maintaining good mental health. Benefit from initiatives such as counseling and support in difficult life situations and a culture where you can openly speak about mental health‚Ä¶.
  • Physically thriving: We support you managing your physical health by taking appropriate preventive measures and providing a workplace that helps you thrive. For example, health care offerings, gyms and healthier ways of working, check up's, standing desks,...
  • Socially connected: We strongly believe in collaboration, inclusion and feeling connected to open up new perspectives and strengthen our self confidence and well being. Benefits vary from different types of paid and unpaid leave, career coaching, flexible working time models, participation in our ERGs,...
  • Financially secure: We support you to meet personal financial goals during your active career and for the future. Benefit from pension contribution plans, banking services for employees, insurance, company bicycles or public transport perks,...


We strive for a culture in which we are empowered to excel together every day. This includes acting responsibly, thinking commercially, taking initiative and working collaboratively.

Together we share and celebrate the successes of our people. Together we are Deutsche Bank Group.

We welcome applications from all people and promote a positive, fair and inclusive work environment.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
*This is an international staff role based at our Headquarters in Washington, D.C. We offer visa and relocation support.




We improve lives

The IDB Group is a community of diverse, versatile, and passionate people who come together on a journey to improve lives in Latin America and the Caribbean. Our people find purpose and do what they love in an inclusive, collaborative, agile, and rewarding environment.

About This Position

We are looking for an analytical, impact-oriented and visually-savvy Data Scientist to join the Regional and Sectoral Data Group (RSD) within the Research Department (RES).

RSD coordinates and supports the efficient management, governance, and reuse of regional and sectoral data generated or obtained through research, knowledge, and operational work that is not produced in the Bank‚Äôs core systems but remains under the responsibility and/or custody of the IDB. This includes both traditional (censuses, surveys, administrative records) and non-traditional (social networks, digital exhaust, satellite imagery, mobile data, etc.) data sources used across VPS, VPC, SPD and other areas. RSD‚Äôs mandate is to turn scattered datasets into strategic, reusable assets that accelerate decisions safely and consistently across the institution.

As a Data Scientist, you will co-design reusable analytical products (from notebooks to production pipelines), apply statistical and machine learning methods, and translate findings into clear, policy-relevant narratives. You will work closely with data engineers and data governance specialists to ensure solutions are FAIR-aligned (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable), privacy-preserving, and ready for pilot-to-production adoption by multiple teams.

What you‚Äôll do

Engage with stakeholders (operations, country teams, researchers) to frame decision problems and turn them into analytical backlogs with clear success metrics.
Analyze complex, multi-source datasets (surveys, admin records, geospatial/satellite, mobile, open data) to detect patterns and produce actionable insights.
Apply statistical/econometric and machine learning techniques (e.g., causal inference, prediction, classification, segmentation, small-area estimation, nowcasting) to support evidence-based and policy.
Build reusable components: features, model pipelines, and production-grade dataflows (in collaboration with data engineers) with version control, testing, and basic MLOps.
Develop interactive visual products (Power BI, Tableau, Plotly/Dash/Streamlit) and clear storytelling to make technical results accessible to non-technical audiences.
Implement data quality checks (schema, range, duplication, drift) and document data lineage/assumptions to ensure reproducibility and auditability.
Work with data governance specialists to uphold privacy-by-design, ethical AI practices, and compliant sharing (e.g., data-use agreements, tiered access).
Contribute to capacity building (playbooks, brown-bags, office hours) with country counterparts and internal teams; promote ‚Äúbuild once‚Äîreuse many‚Äù practices.
Continuously explore and evaluate new tools (including AI/LLMs), keeping a pragmatic focus on impact, robustness, and maintainability

What you'll need

Education: Master‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Economics, Computer/Data Science, or a related quantitative field.

Experience

At least 5 years in data science/analytics/applied research, demonstrating strong skills in statistical modeling, econometrics, machine learning, and quantitative analysis.
Proven experience building data systems and analytical products in international development organizations (e.g., MDBs/UN/INGOs/governments) and/or the private sector (e.g., tech, consulting, civic tech), including work with national statistical offices or government data producers.
Experience integrating traditional and non-traditional data (e.g., surveys + admin + geospatial/mobile) and taking solutions from prototype to pilot/production.
Familiarity with LAC context and working in multilingual, multi-stakeholder environments is highly desirable.

Languages: Proficiency in English and one of the other IDB official languages (Spanish, French, or Portuguese) is required.

Requirements

Citizenship: You are a citizen of one of our 48-member countries. We may offer assistance with relocation and visa applications for you and your eligible dependents.
Consanguinity: You have no family members (up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB, IDB Invest, or IDB Lab.

Type of contract and duration

International staff contract, 36 months initially, renewable upon mutual agreement.

What we offer

The IDB group provides benefits that respond to the different needs and moments of an employee's life. These benefits include:

A competitive compensation package, including an annual base salary expressed on a net-of-tax basis
Leaves and vacations: 24 days of paid time off + 8 personal days + sick leave + gender-neutral parental leave
Health Insurance: the IDB Group provides employees and eligible dependents with a robust medical benefits program which covers medical, dental, vision, preventive care, and prescription drugs.
Pension plan: defined benefit pension plan that provides financial security and supports employees in planning for their future.
We offer assistance with relocation and visa applications for you and your family, when it applies.
Hybrid and flexible work schedules
Health and wellbeing: Access to our Health Services Center which provides preventive care and health education for employees.
Development support: We offer tools to boost your professional profile such as mentoring, 1:1 professional counseling, training and learning opportunities, language classes, mobility options, among others.
Other perks: Lactation Room, Daycare Center, Gym, Bike Racks, Parking, Spouse Career Program, and others.

Our culture

At the IDB, we work so everyone brings their best and authentic selves to work while finding their purpose. Our people consistently strive for excellence, and we recognize and celebrate the impact of their contributions.

In our efforts to drive innovation, we intentionally include all voices, cultivate a sense of belonging and champion fairness. We welcome individuals from underrepresented groups to join us and share their unique perspectives.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodations to participate in the job interview process. If you require an accommodation to complete this application, please email us at accommodations@iadb.org.

Title: AI Scientist - Data & AI Officer (CDAIO)
Place: Boadilla del Monte, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
CHIEF DATA & ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE OFFICER (CDAIO) is looking for an AI SCIENTIST, based in our BOADILLA DEL MONTE (Madrid) office.







WHY YOU SHOULD CONSIDER THIS OPPORTUNITY




At Santander (www.santander.com) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join uS?




Our Chief Data & Artificial Intelligence Officer (CDAIO) division is building a world-class AI & Data team to make a difference in the lives of over 170 million people worldwide, through one of the largest banks in the world.




We are undergoing one of the biggest transformations in our history and technology is at the heart of our strategy. Join our team to play a part in one of the most important technological projects for the financial sector in the world.




Our mission is to contribute to helping more people and businesses prosper. We embrace a strong risk culture and all our professionals at all levels are expected to take a proactive and responsible approach toward risk management.




Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, disability, civil status, race, religion or sexual orientation.




This job offer is an opportunity not only to join a great company but also to collaborate in projects that have a real impact on society.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING




As an AI SCIENTIST, you will work with vast datasets to develop models that solve real-world problems, collaborate with talented colleagues across disciplines, and connect with the broader AI community to push scientific and practical boundaries.




We are looking for curious, driven AI scientists who want their work to drive innovation with real impact. If you love tackling big challenges, banking offers some of the most complex and high-stakes AI problems, from risk management to financial inclusion, done responsibly and on a scale.




We need someone like you to help us in different fronts:

Research, design, and implement advanced AI algorithms (ML, DL, NLP, and beyond) to solve complex problems.
Translate business challenges into scientific problem statements and build impactful ML/AI prototypes and models that deliver business impact.
Work with large-scale structured and unstructured data to develop models that are accurate, fair, and sustainable.
Collaborate with Data Engineers, MLOps Engineers, Product Owners, and Business Stakeholders to deploy solutions into production.
production.Contribute to AI best practices, model governance, and responsible AI
Stay current with the latest AI research and integrate relevant tools and techniques.
Communicate insights and results clearly to both technical and non-technical
audiences.Foster collaboration with academia and the global AI community to bring cutting-edge research into Santander.




EXPERIENCE

Ideally, 3-5 years of experience working with vast datasets and developing models.




EDUCATION

PhD or MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related fields.







SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

Demonstrable impact of AI solutions deployed in production environments, or strong publication record in top-tier AI/ML conferences or journals
Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages, and deep knowledge of AI/ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, or Hugging Face Transformers.
Experience in end-to-end model development, inluding experimentation, deployment, adaptation, and monitoring.
Solid understanding of model evaluation metrics, bias mitigation, explainability, and fairness in AI.
English level fluent or high.




OTHER INFORMATION

Hands-on experience with Generative AI, including large language models or diffusion models in production.
Expertise in scalable AI infrastructure, cloud deployments, and MLOps.Deep domain knowledge in financial services or other regulated industries.
Strong contributions to open-source projects or recognized leadership in the global AI community.




If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

  • PhD or MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related fields.



SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

  • Demonstrable impact of AI solutions deployed in production environments, or strong publication record in top-tier AI/ML conferences or journals
  • Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages, and deep knowledge of AI/ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, or Hugging Face Transformers.
  • Experience in end-to-end model development, inluding experimentation, deployment, adaptation, and monitoring.
  • Solid understanding of model evaluation metrics, bias mitigation, explainability, and fairness in AI.
  • English level fluent or high.


OTHER INFORMATION

  • Hands-on experience with Generative AI, including large language models or diffusion models in production.
  • Expertise in scalable AI infrastructure, cloud deployments, and MLOps.Deep domain knowledge in financial services or other regulated industries.
  • Strong contributions to open-source projects or recognized leadership in the global AI community.


If you want to know more about us, follow us on https://es.linkedin.com/company/banco-santander

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
Company Description

As an NIQ company, we are the world's leading consumer intelligence firm, delivering the Full View‚Ñ¢ on consumer behavior. We work to enable manufacturers and retailers better understand what consumers really want. Our name has inspired trust for over 89 years because we take pride in discovering new pathways to sustainable growth for our clients, our people, and our planet.

We are always looking for open-minded people who will grow with us, push boundaries, and pioneer disruptive methods in market research, data science, technology, and AI. If you share this passion to drive things forward and the integrity to insist on doing things the right way, we'll equip you to take your future into your own hands and play a leading role in our story.

Job Description

Mission


Develop Marketing Science solutions in the area of media analytics
Support the product development during concept testing phases, scaling and production
Transform proofs-of-concept into scalable, production-ready code


Responsibilities


Develop, implement and standardize marketing science solutions in proofs-of-concept and prototypes
Continuously improve the efficiency of the marketing science products (e.g. ensure quality by adherence to coding guidelines, documentation and reproducibility)
Optimize marketing science models using code optimization, high-performance computing and real-time techniques
Build analytical pipelines at scale using cloud services, containerized applications and distributed systems
Identify best practices and create continuous improvement of tools and methods
Closely collaborate with Product Owners, Modellers, Marketing Scientists and Front End Software Engineers


Qualifications


Bachelor or Master degree that reflects strong statistical/mathematical/computer science skills
Strong expertize in Python usage - at least 3 years of development
Understanding of R
Experienced in statistical modelling on top of predictive modeling
Able to manage code deployments (experience with GIT)
Basic understanding of Dockerization ‚Äì building and managing docker images
Experienced with creating, managing and/or maintaining code documentation
Solid skills concerning performance optimization and scalability (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, functions as a service)
Ability to present and explain complex concepts to less experienced colleagues


Soft Skills


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to work independently
Good attention to detail ‚Äì ensure all outputs are delivered professionally and accurate
Good interpersonal skills ‚Äì treat others with respect, be cooperative, friendly and considerate of others. Be a good role model, help to build teamwork and team spirit
Well-organised and flexible, and demonstrate self-confidence, decisiveness and commitment able to work alone without constant support, and well organized
Ease of communication in an English-speaking business environment


Additional Information

Hybrid : 1 a week at Madrid office - Flex working mode

Our Benefits


Flexible working environment
Volunteer time off
LinkedIn Learning
Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)


About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Want to keep up with our latest updates?

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At NIQ, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace that mirrors the rich diversity of the communities and markets we serve. We believe that embracing a wide range of perspectives drives innovation and excellence. All employment decisions at NIQ are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We invite individuals who share our dedication to inclusivity and equity to join us in making a meaningful impact. To learn more about our ongoing efforts in diversity and inclusion, please visit the https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

  • Experienced with creating, managing and/or maintaining code documentation
  • Solid skills concerning performance optimization and scalability (e.g., parallelization, code optimization, functions as a service)
  • Ability to present and explain complex concepts to less experienced colleagues

Soft Skills

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Able to work independently
  • Good attention to detail ‚Äì ensure all outputs are delivered professionally and accurate
  • Good interpersonal skills ‚Äì treat others with respect, be cooperative, friendly and considerate of others. Be a good role model, help to build teamwork and team spirit
  • Well-organised and flexible, and demonstrate self-confidence, decisiveness and commitment able to work alone without constant support, and well organized
  • Ease of communication in an English-speaking business environment

Additional Information

Hybrid : 1 a week at Madrid office - Flex working mode

Our Benefits

  • Flexible working environment
  • Volunteer time off
  • LinkedIn Learning
  • Employee-Assistance-Program (EAP)

About NIQ

NIQ is the world‚Äôs leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights‚Äîdelivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms‚ÄîNIQ delivers the Full View‚Ñ¢. NIQ is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world‚Äôs population.

For more information, visit NIQ.com

Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At NIQ, we are steadfast in our commitment to fostering an inclusive workplace that mirrors the rich diversity of the communities and markets we serve. We believe that embracing a wide range of perspectives drives innovation and excellence. All employment decisions at NIQ are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, sexual orientation, or gender identity), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We invite individuals who share our dedication to inclusivity and equity to join us in making a meaningful impact. To learn more about our ongoing efforts in diversity and inclusion, please visit the https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




We are looking for an Account Director to lead and develop campaigns for our clients. The work is developed for Spain and Portugal, and we are seeking someone with a clear strategic and business vision to help us grow and expand our operations.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Scientist




We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong expertise in building predictive models, performing advanced statistical analysis, and generating actionable insights to support ecommerce growth. The ideal candidate will be highly proficient in data science methodologies and comfortable working across the full data lifecycle ‚Äî from engineering pipelines to delivering strategic recommendations through data storytelling. This role requires experience with cloud platforms, advanced analytics tools, and the ability to translate business needs into data-driven solutions.




‚úîÔ∏è ¬øWhat will be your challenges and responsibilities at Cheil? ¬øWhat do we expect from you?




End-to-End Data Science Workflow: Lead the full data science lifecycle ‚Äî from data ingestion, wrangling, and modeling to insight generation and presentation.
Data Infrastructure & Engineering Collaboration:
Understand and map internal and external data sources, assessing data structure, accessibility, and quality.
Build and maintain data pipelines using Spark (in Python or Scala) and orchestrate jobs with Airflow.
Work with BigQuery and other GCP tools to manage cloud-based storage and processing efficiently.
Monitor pipeline performance, data quality, and cloud cost optimization.
Advanced Analytics & Statistical Modeling:
Design and deploy models for predictive analytics (e.g., sales forecasting, customer segmentation, time-series analysis).
Apply statistical methods to interpret business trends, quantify impact, and optimize decision-making.
Evaluate and improve model accuracy and performance over time.
Visualization, Dashboards & Reporting:
Translate complex insights into clear, visually compelling dashboards using Looker Studio (preferred), Tableau, or Power BI.
Build campaign and initiative-specific dashboards to support marketing, ecommerce, and strategic reporting needs.
Present data stories and recommendations to business stakeholders, including non-technical audiences.
Tooling & Development Environment:
Work in modern development environments with version control (Git) and collaborative workflow tools.
Develop and document scalable, reusable code and data models using tools like Python, SQL, and Spark.
Understand and apply best practices in cloud computing, IAM, and task orchestration.
Cross-functional Collaboration & Business Alignment:
Partner with ecommerce, marketing, CRM, and product teams to define analytical goals and translate them into data solutions.
Ensure alignment between data projects and business KPIs, proactively identifying high-impact use cases.
Drive data literacy within the team by sharing documentation, code, and insights with other departments.
Strategic Data Planning:
Identify ‚Äúquick win‚Äù opportunities to demonstrate data science impact in the short term.
Help define initial OKRs for the Data Science function and participate in roadmap discussions for long-term initiatives.
Stay up to date with industry best practices and emerging technologies to continuously elevate our data maturity.




‚úîÔ∏è Requirements:




3‚Äì5 years of experience in Data Science, Predictive Modeling, or Advanced Analytics, ideally in ecommerce, digital marketing, or agency environments.
Strong expertise in Python (Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.) and SQL (preferably with BigQuery).
Proven experience building and deploying data models for segmentation, forecasting, and pattern detection.
Experience designing and maintaining data pipelines with Spark (in Python or Scala).
Knowledge of task orchestration tools like Airflow and version control systems like Git.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (preferably Google Cloud Platform) for data storage, processing, and compute scalability.
Strong understanding of relational and non-relational databases, and ability to optimize data extraction and queries.
Experience building interactive dashboards and reporting tools with Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI.
Understanding of data quality, governance, and cost monitoring in cloud architectures.
Ability to communicate complex technical outputs to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and structure.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Data Scientist Gen AI
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure Securitas Direct: ‚ÄúPersonas que protegemos personas‚Äù

At the forefront of the European market, Verisure Securitas Direct leads with its intelligent alarms, delivering exceptional services to over 5 million customers in 17 countries across Europe and Latin America. With a team of over 20,000 employees, we are dedicated to security and service excellence.

Professional Opportunity: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Generative AI

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist specialized in Generative AI who will report directly to the Head Of AI & Advanced Analytics PortFolio Team (Marketing Cliente). Your mission will be to develop and optimize AI models, particularly LLMs and GenAI solutions, to address business needs using data from various sources. You will collaborate closely with IT for implementation, validation, monitoring, and maintenance, as well as with business units across different countries to ensure the practical application of AI-driven solutions.

We are looking for someone with a strategic vision, customer focus, and operational efficiency, capable of driving innovation in AI while effectively communicating insights and recommendations. If this sounds like you, join our exceptional team.

Requirements:

Education:

Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields.

Experience:

Over 3 years of experience in Data Science, with proven experience in Generative AI.

Hands-on experience with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), advanced prompting techniques, and fine-tuning of Large Language Models (LLMs).

Hard Skills:

Deep understanding of LLM architectures, including Transformer models (GPT, BERT, T5, etc.).
Experience in fine-tuning, customizing, and deploying LLMs on cloud platforms.
Expertise in RAG techniques to enhance model retrieval and response accuracy.
Strong knowledge of prompt engineering, prompt tuning, and optimization techniques.
Proficiency in AI orchestration frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar.
Solid programming skills in Python (experience with Hugging Face, TensorFlow, PyTorch is highly valued).
Strong knowledge of SQL for efficient data querying and preprocessing.
Hands-on experience in cloud-based AI solutions (AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, GCP Vertex AI).
Experience in real-time AI implementations and monitoring.
Knowledge of MLOps best practices for AI model deployment and lifecycle management.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Power BI, Streamlit, or similar) is desirable.
Experience in project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum) is desirable.
Advanced English (+C1); part of the work will be conducted in English (oral and written).

Soft Skills:

Strong teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills.
Ability to lead and drive AI transformation projects across different countries.
Storytelling and communication skills to explain complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including senior management.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills.
Innovative mindset with a passion for exploring new AI trends and technologies.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of Generative AI and working on cutting-edge projects that impact millions of customers, we want to hear from you!

Your mission will be to develop and optimize AI models, particularly LLMs and GenAI solutions, to address business needs using data from various sources. You will collaborate closely with IT for implementation, validation, monitoring, and maintenance, as well as with business units across different countries to ensure the practical application of AI-driven solutions.

We are looking for someone with a strategic vision, customer focus, and operational efficiency, capable of driving innovation in AI while effectively communicating insights and recommendations. If this sounds like you, join our exceptional team.

Requirements:

Education:

Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields.

Experience:

Over 3 years of experience in Data Science, with proven experience in Generative AI.

Hands-on experience with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), advanced prompting techniques, and fine-tuning of Large Language Models (LLMs).

Hard Skills:

  • Deep understanding of LLM architectures, including Transformer models (GPT, BERT, T5, etc.).
  • Experience in fine-tuning, customizing, and deploying LLMs on cloud platforms.
  • Expertise in RAG techniques to enhance model retrieval and response accuracy.
  • Strong knowledge of prompt engineering, prompt tuning, and optimization techniques.
  • Proficiency in AI orchestration frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar.
  • Solid programming skills in Python (experience with Hugging Face, TensorFlow, PyTorch is highly valued).
  • Strong knowledge of SQL for efficient data querying and preprocessing.
  • Hands-on experience in cloud-based AI solutions (AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, GCP Vertex AI).
  • Experience in real-time AI implementations and monitoring.
  • Knowledge of MLOps best practices for AI model deployment and lifecycle management.
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools (Power BI, Streamlit, or similar) is desirable.
  • Experience in project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum) is desirable.
  • Advanced English (+C1); part of the work will be conducted in English (oral and written).

Soft Skills:

  • Strong teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills.
  • Ability to lead and drive AI transformation projects across different countries.
  • Storytelling and communication skills to explain complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including senior management.
  • Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills.
  • Innovative mindset with a passion for exploring new AI trends and technologies.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of Generative AI and working on cutting-edge projects that impact millions of customers, we want to hear from you!

Title: AI Scientist - Data & AI Office
Description:
At Santander (www.santander.com) we are key players in the transformation of the financial sector. Do you want to join us?




Our Chief Data & Artificial Intelligence Officer (CDAIO) division is building a world-class AI & Data team to make a difference in the lives of over 170 million people worldwide, through one of the largest banks in the world.




We are undergoing one of the biggest transformations in our history and technology is at the heart of our strategy. Join our team to play a part in one of the most important technological projects for the financial sector in the world.




Our mission is to contribute to helping more people and businesses prosper. We embrace a strong risk culture and all our professionals at all levels are expected to take a proactive and responsible approach toward risk management.




Santander is proud of being an organization where there are equal opportunities regardless of age, gender, disability, civil status, race, religion or sexual orientation.




This job offer is an opportunity not only to join a great company but also to collaborate in projects that have a real impact on society.




WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING




As an AI SCIENTIST, you will work with vast datasets to develop models that solve real-world problems, collaborate with talented colleagues across disciplines, and connect with the broader AI community to push scientific and practical boundaries.




We are looking for curious, driven AI scientists who want their work to drive innovation with real impact. If you love tackling big challenges, banking offers some of the most complex and high-stakes AI problems, from risk management to financial inclusion, done responsibly and on a scale.




We need someone like you to help us in different fronts:

Research, design, and implement advanced AI algorithms (ML, DL, NLP, and beyond) to solve complex problems.
Translate business challenges into scientific problem statements and build impactful ML/AI prototypes and models that deliver business impact.
Work with large-scale structured and unstructured data to develop models that are accurate, fair, and sustainable.
Collaborate with Data Engineers, MLOps Engineers, Product Owners, and Business Stakeholders to deploy solutions into production.
Contribute to AI best practices, model governance, and responsible AI frameworks.
Stay current with the latest AI research and integrate relevant tools and techniques.
Communicate insights and results clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Foster collaboration with academia and the global AI community to bring cutting-edge research into Santander.




EXPERIENCE

Ideally, 3-5 years of experience working with vast datasets and developing models.




EDUCATION

PhD or MSc in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or a related field.




SKILLS & KNOWLEDGE

Demonstrable impact of AI solutions deployed in production environments, or strong publication record in top-tier AI/ML conferences or journals.
Strong programming skills in Python or similar languages, and deep knowledge of AI/ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, or Hugging Face Transformers.
Experience in end-to-end model development, inluding experimentation, deployment, adaptation, and monitoring.
Solid understanding of model evaluation metrics, bias mitigation, explainability, and fairness in AI.
English level fluent or high.




OTHER INFORMATION

Hands-on experience with Generative AI, including large language models or diffusion models in production.
Expertise in scalable AI infrastructure, cloud deployments, and MLOps.
Deep domain knowledge in financial services or other regulated industries.
Strong contributions to open-source projects or recognized leadership in the global AI community.

Title: Data Scientist Associate/Manager ‚Äì Analytics Transformation
Description:
¬øTe entusiasma hacer crecer tu carrera?

BBVA es una compa√±√≠a global con m√°s de 160 a√±os de historia que opera en m√°s de 25 pa√≠ses donde damos servicio a m√°s de 80 millones de clientes. Somos m√°s de 121.000 profesionales trabajando en equipos multidisciplinares con perfiles tan diversos como financieros, expertos legales, cient√≠ficos de datos, desarrolladores, ingenieros y dise√±adores.

Conoce m√°s sobre el √°rea:

La vacante estar√° activa en la web hasta el 18 de septiembre inclusive.*

GRM Data & Analytics is the Discipline, within the Global Risk Management function, responsible for the development of methodologies and models for risk measurement in the BBVA group. The analysis and use of new data sources and the implementation of the most advanced modelling techniques for risk purposes is the core activity of our team.

Sobre el puesto

Are you a Data Scientist looking for new opportunities? Would you like to join the company which is leading the financial sector transformation? Could you help us achieve our goal to become a Data Driven Company?

About the role, what you should know:

Based in Madrid, the successful candidate will join the Transformation CoE (Centre of Expertise) within the GRM Data & Analytics area, a spearhead of innovation within BBVA‚Äôs global holding, and will assume the leadership of data transformation projects in the development of Risk Modelling Innovation Lab, covering risk models, calibrations and capital/provisions calculations among other tasks.

This role will be central to BBVA‚Äôs strategic transformation of risk analytics, combining advanced modelling with automation, MLOps and GenAI to build scalable, modern solutions with direct impact across all geographies. It is an excellent opportunity for a talented individual who is keen to join a very ambitious and transformational project in a high performance team.

You will have access to state of the art tools, including GenAI solutions from OpenAI, Google Gemini and Microsoft Copilot, together with the full capacity of cloud infrastructure, enabling you to deliver next generation risk management solutions. As part of the transversal Advanced Analytics area, we provide a comprehensive training plan in machine learning and generative AI, developed in collaboration with the University of Navarra, Universidad Carlos III and BBVA‚Äôs internal programs. This is complemented by specialized training in finance, banking and regulatory knowledge.

In this role, the candidate will:


Define and develop new analytical modules in the modelling platform focused on the transformation towards new data, state of the art methodologies and the use of the most advanced algorithms to optimise decisions, tempos and performance in the Bank‚Äôs new analytical infrastructure.
Apply MLOps principles to automate and streamline the model lifecycle, including orchestration, versioning, deployment, and monitoring.
Take responsibility to ensure code quality, performance, usability and results are properly managed and maintained to support business objectives.
Research and Innovate integrating generative AI technologies to continue to be the spearhead in the sector and drive the modernization of risk management.
Structure and synthesise results to provide intuitive metrics and reportings to boost and optimise the decision process.
Manage dependencies and risks to ensure the successful implementation of the project.
Work, under agile methodology, with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams from Risk, Data, Engineering and Local Units.


Qualifications:


With 4+ years of experience in a Data Scientist role or similar, with MSc and/or PhD in Mathematics, Physics , Statistics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field. They should also have experience using the following software/tools:
Experience with big data and analytic tools: Spark and Python is a must.
Experience with software development: QA, git, unit testing, copilots
Experience with HTML, JS and other web development tools will be valued.
Extensive knowledge in Statistical, Machine Learning, GenAI and Optimisation techniques.
Knowledge in cloud services (like AWS Sagemaker) and MLOps principles and automation of the model lifecycle, including orchestration, deployment, and monitoring in production environments.
Experience with Generative AI technologies (multi-agent, RAG) and their application in improving analytical processes will be highly valuable.
With a successful history of defining, developing and managing a software library with value endorsed by stakeholders.
Knowledge of credit models (previous experience in model developing or model validation) is a plus.
Minimum level of English (B2).
Minimum level of Spanish (B2).

About you:

We are looking for an enthusiastic individual, who has the following characteristics:


Exceptional problem-solving skills and a results-driven mindset.
Proven record of leadership in complex projects involving several areas of the organisation.
Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with people at all seniority levels.
Project management skills. Stakeholder and dependencies management experience is a must.
Ability to communicate and explain complex ideas effectively (verbally and in writing), in a simple and clear manner.


Habilidades:

ADA, ADA, √Ålgebra, Algoritmo de optimizaci√≥n, Algoritmos de ML (Clasificaci√≥n), Algoritmos de ML (Predicci√≥n), An√°lisis de componentes principales (ACP), An√°lisis de datos, Anal√≠tica de riesgos, Aprendizaje autom√°tico, Bitbucket, C√°lculo multivariable, Cl√∫steres de datos, Ecuaciones diferenciales, Estad√≠stica, Estad√≠sticas descriptivas, Fuente de datos, Gesti√≥n √°gil de proyectos, Gesti√≥n de riesgos, Gesti√≥n de riesgos globales, Gesti√≥n estrat√©gica de proyectos, Idioma ingl√©s, Innovaci√≥n, Investigaci√≥n, Metodolog√≠a √°gil {+ 8 adicionales}

Title: Junior Data Scientist - MAD/BCN/Cluj
Description:
Mission

Are you ready to take part in the upcoming AI revolution of the business world? If the answer is a resounding "yes," we have an extraordinary opportunity for you!‚ÄØ

We are looking for a Junior Data Scientist in Madrid, Barcelona, or Cluj to be part of the AI Agentic AI team. You would get a chance to be part of the development of features of our products and perform the following tasks:


Translate business needs to technical requirements
Define strategy for use of data and how data use interacts with data design
Create and document reusable packages and libraries in Python and other languages
Perform data studies and data discovery around new data sources or new uses for existing data sources
Develop, train, finetune and industrialize ML models
Implement and hands-off data checking and updating procedures to other teams
Be a member of an AI laboratory performing discovery tasks and developing AI products
Develop end-to-end data science applications, including complex distributed data processing, creating an analysis framework (e.g. models, algorithms, etc.), developing custom complex visualization tools, and deploying web applications.
Enthusiasm for the latest developments in LLMs and Agentic AI


Your profile


Until 2 years of experience in data science
Experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL)
Experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)
Experience performing ETL functions and understanding data quality steps
Strong in quantitative analysis, statistics, or mathematics
Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience
Ability to work in a fast pace and learn quickly
(Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning
(Bonus) Experience with regression modeling, forecasting, and/ or time series analysis
(Bonus) Experience with NLP
(Bonus) Experience with visualization tools (Shiny, Power BI, Tableau)
(Bonus) AWS Cloud/Azure experience/exposure


Who are we?

Founded in 2020 in Munich, we at Aily Labs are a rapidly expanding start-up in the B2B SaaS area. We've already assembled a super innovative, smart, and fun team of almost 320+ highly motivated employees around our offices in Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, Cluj, and New York. ‚ÄØ

At Aily Labs, we have the bold mission to democratize AI. Our groundbreaking product is an AI-powered mobile app that uses cutting-edge GenAI and traditional ML to unlock valuable business insights and gives personalized recommendations. Our aim? Disrupting the way corporate entities operate, paving the way for the world's first AI decision intelligence platform that enables faster, simpler, and smarter decision-making across the entire value chain, aiming towards full Agentic automation of key business goals.

What sets us apart?

By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of this transformative movement, shaping the future of intelligent decision-making in remarkable ways.

What We Offer


Flexible working culture: Work from home and one of our offices (Madrid, BCN or Cluj).
Healthcare coverage with Sanitas (for Spain)
Latest devices to be a master: MacBook Pro M2 16GB
We are an internationally diverse team that supports one another
‚ÄØShare your knowledge and enjoy with your teammates in our bootcamps and AilyConnection events
We give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us
There‚Äôs the opportunity to get involved in University Collaboration and publishing papers


About Us

  • Enthusiasm for the latest developments in LLMs and Agentic AI

Your profile

  • Until 2 years of experience in data science
  • Experience with data programming/ scripting languages (Python, R, SQL)
  • Experience in machine-learning methodologies (supervised /unsupervised, deep learning)
  • Experience performing ETL functions and understanding data quality steps
  • Strong in quantitative analysis, statistics, or mathematics
  • Experience in communicating technically, at a level appropriate for the audience
  • Ability to work in a fast pace and learn quickly
  • (Bonus) Master in Data Science /Machine Learning
  • (Bonus) Experience with regression modeling, forecasting, and/ or time series analysis
  • (Bonus) Experience with NLP
  • (Bonus) Experience with visualization tools (Shiny, Power BI, Tableau)
  • (Bonus) AWS Cloud/Azure experience/exposure

Who are we?

Founded in 2020 in Munich, we at Aily Labs are a rapidly expanding start-up in the B2B SaaS area. We've already assembled a super innovative, smart, and fun team of almost 320+ highly motivated employees around our offices in Munich, Barcelona, Madrid, Cluj, and New York. ‚ÄØ

At Aily Labs, we have the bold mission to democratize AI. Our groundbreaking product is an AI-powered mobile app that uses cutting-edge GenAI and traditional ML to unlock valuable business insights and gives personalized recommendations. Our aim? Disrupting the way corporate entities operate, paving the way for the world's first AI decision intelligence platform that enables faster, simpler, and smarter decision-making across the entire value chain, aiming towards full Agentic automation of key business goals.

What sets us apart?

By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to be at the forefront of this transformative movement, shaping the future of intelligent decision-making in remarkable ways.

What We Offer

  • Flexible working culture: Work from home and one of our offices (Madrid, BCN or Cluj).
  • Healthcare coverage with Sanitas (for Spain)
  • Latest devices to be a master: MacBook Pro M2 16GB
  • We are an internationally diverse team that supports one another
  • ‚ÄØShare your knowledge and enjoy with your teammates in our bootcamps and AilyConnection events
  • We give freedom for further training because lifelong learning is important to us
  • There‚Äôs the opportunity to get involved in University Collaboration and publishing papers

About Us

LEARN MORE

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.

As a trusted voice for many of the world‚Äôs most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

About The Role

GreenPowerMonitor, a DNV company, is at the heart of global energy transformation. We use data-driven digital solutions to optimize the performance of renewable energy installations around the world. Our work contributes to a more diverse and sustainable global energy mix.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our team and contribute to the support and development of data-driven solutions in the renewable energy sector. If you are passionate about data, fluent in Python, and experienced in statistics, time series analysis, and boosting techniques, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities


Analyze time series data and perform data quality control for wind, solar, and storage technologies.
Apply statistical and machine learning techniques to uncover insights from complex datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate analytical outputs into operational workflows.
Train and evaluate models with effective hyperparameter tuning and result validation to support business decisions.
Use Kubernetes to manage and deploy machine learning workflows in containerized environments.
Work with databases such as MongoDB, ClickHouse, and PostgreSQL, for data storage and processing.


This is a unique chance to apply your data science skills to real-world challenges in renewable energy. You'll work with advanced tools and technologies, contribute to impactful projects, and help accelerate the global shift toward a sustainable energy future.

What we offer

Our benefits package is specifically designed to support your physical, financial and social wellbeing:


Great atmosphere of working together with professionals and some of the most engaged and knowledgeable people in the industry.
Guidance from colleagues through coaching, mentoring and participating in international networks.
Numerous opportunities to advance your professional skills and technical expertise through individual competence development plans and tailored training.
Multiple country specific lifestyle benefits, including health insurance, pension plan, flexible work schedule, trainings, etc.
Be part of a world growing and renowned organization with origins dating back to 1864.


DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.

About You

To thrive and succeed, you have:


Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science.
Strong proficiency in Python, including libraries such as NumPy, Pandas and Scikit-learn.
Solid foundation in applied statistics, including the series analysis, clustering, distribution analysis, and hypothesis testing.
Practical experience with machine learning algorithms, especially clustering, regression and boosting methods (e.g. XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost).
Experience in hyperparameter tuning and model performance optimization.
Hands-on experience with time series modeling and analysis.
Working knowledge of databases such as MongoDB, ClickHouse, or PostgreSQL.
Proficient in Git for version control and collaborative development.


Will Be a Plus


Familiarity with AutoML tools to streamline model development.
Basic Knowledge of Kuberflow for orchestrating machine learning workflows.
Experience with cloud platforms (Kubernetes, AWS, Azure) and containerization tools like Docker is a plus.
Prior experience int he renewable energy domain is a strong advantage.
Deep learning techniques and frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch is a plus.


As a person, you demonstrate strong analytical thinking, curiosity, and a problem-solving mindset. You can work both independently and collaboratively, communicating complex finding clearly to nontechnical stakeholders. A high level of attention to detail, adaptability, and a passion for continuous learning are essential, especially in fast evolving environments like renewable energy. Strong teamwork, ownership, and a proactive attitude toward challenges and innovation are key to thriving in this role.

Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.

Title: Data Science Trainee
Description:
Your main purpose

Help with the data preparation for modeling.

Help with the development of new ML models.

Help with GenAI process.

Help with data analysis.

Apply your work to Chatbots (text and voice), Marketing Mix Modeling, and sales forecasting.

Use NLU / GenAI to improve guest experience: automatic replies, inquiries categorization, summarization, etc.

What will you bring?

Solid knowledge of at least one of the following: Python, SQL, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn.

Familiarity with at least one of the following: TensorFlow, PyTorch, ML algorithms.

Nice to have knowledge of visualization and BI tools like: Matplotlib, Seaborn, Power BI.

Nice to have: Azure, AWS, Google Cloud exposure, GenAI (GPT, Claude, embeddings), Git/GitHub, Docker, Airflow, Spark, MLOps, ETL.

Nice to have: FastAPI, Flask, Streamlit.

Fluency in English (minimum B2 level; C1 preferred).

Title: Data Scientist (Credit)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 60+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else ‚Äì with class, logical thinking, and lots of style üòé Let‚Äôs break it down: we take the most complex problems and create tailor-made solutions for our customers üöÄ If you‚Äôre thinking the Data team is kept in some sort of a secret den, doomed to never see the impact of their work, don‚Äôt worry - that‚Äôs not how we do things. They‚Äôre some of our best and brightest problem-solvers, deployed to the front lines to work in product teams and deliver rockstar solutions ü§ò

We start with deep data analysis to understand our customers, their objectives and any issues they might have. We then use various data points and advanced machine learning algorithms, to come up with the best possible option for each client. We experiment, iterate, and build fully automated solutions, based on algorithms which self-improve with time.

We‚Äôre looking for next-level Data Scientists to board our FinTech rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Phew! It‚Äôs a big task, but you won‚Äôt do it alone. üí™

You‚Äôll be working with the toughest and most gifted professionals in Product, Design, Data Science and Engineering, on impactful projects that‚Äôll make our company move forward ‚è©

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Building models for full Retail Credit lifecycle
Improving existing algorithms and building new Proofs of Concept
Delivering real impact to the product through rigorous data-driven solutions
Researching and then delivering PoCs into data products
Collaborating with product owners, engineers, and data scientists to continually solve complex data problems


What You'll Need


Experience working in a data science team of a credit institution
A Bachelor's/Master's/PhD in STEM (Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering)
Excellent knowledge of data science tools, including, python coding, SQL and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
A big-picture mindset to correctly diagnose problems, produce research, and discover solutions
Excellent communication and collaboration skills to partner with Product Owners and business heads


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Important notice for candidates:

Job scams are on the rise. Please keep these guidelines in mind when applying for any open roles.


Only apply through official Revolut channels. We don‚Äôt use any third-party services or platforms for our recruitment.
Always double-check the emails you receive. Make sure all communications are being done through official Revolut emails, with an @revolut.com domain.


We won't ask for payment or personal financial information during the hiring process. If anyone does ask you for this, it‚Äôs a scam. Report it immediately.

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with Revolut. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with Revolut may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with Revolut's <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most‚ÄØinnovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they‚ÄØprovide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are‚ÄØthe same.

Hybrid Intelligence is an international team of data and artificial intelligence experts. Our work is a fusion of applied mathematics, scientific computing, artificial intelligence, and software engineering. We deliver revolutionary and multidisciplinary solutions for our clients driven by research and development, addressing generational challenges of humanity, from discovering new medical treatments to harnessing green energy. We are dedicated to creating a diverse environment and are proud to offer equal opportunities. We appreciate people for who they are and value the diversity they bring to the team.

About The Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our team. You will work with a team of experts where you can learn and develop professionally while participating in the growth and expansion of the team.

Your profile:


PhD or graduates in mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, or related fields.
At least 3 years of previous experience as a Data Scientist. Excellent programming skills (essential) in R, Python (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn), experience in object-oriented programming and pySpark.
Experience in carrying out projects involving Machine Learning algorithms, ideally in a cloud environment (AWS, Azure or GCP) with distributed computing.
Proficiency in data handling, including cleaning, preprocessing, and transforming raw data into usable formats for analysis and modeling.
Experience in developing mathematical models and predictive algorithms (optimization, supervised and unsupervised models, clustering, neural networks...), Deep Learning, MLOps is valued.
Knowledge in natural language processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs) is a plus.
Proficiency in English and Spanish and strong communication skills.
Location: Barcelona or Madrid.


We value all applications and encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply. Having a disability certificate will be positively considered as part of our inclusion and diversity policy.

We offer an extensive range of training opportunities, including in-person, online, and certification courses. Even if you don't meet 100% of the required skills, we'd love to get to know you! Our commitment to inclusion and equal opportunities is reflected in our Equality Plan and Ethical Code, which guarantee professional development and equal opportunities for selection in an environment free from discrimination based on ethnicity, nationality, social origin, age, sexual orientation, gender expression, religion, or any other personal, physical, or social circumstance.

Why You'll Love Working Here

We offer a comprehensive set of development and work-life balance benefits, including (but not limited to):


Buddy Program to support you during your first steps with us.
Generous time off: 24 vacation days + 2 personal days + December 24th and 31st off. You also have the option to purchase up to 7 additional vacation days per year.
Continuous learning opportunities through MyLearning, Capgemini University, and our Digital Campuses. You'll have access to platforms such as Coursera, Udemy, Pluralsight, Harvard Manager Mentor, and Education First for language learning (English, French, German, etc.).
A global DATA & AI community, where you can collaborate with experts from around the world.


Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market leading capabilities in AI, generative AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem.
