Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




What you will do

We are seeking a seasoned and strategic Senior Data Scientist to join our high-impact Data Science team. This is a leadership-oriented role where you‚Äôll guide data initiatives that influence key decisions across product, sales, marketing, operations, and customer experience. You will partner with stakeholders to drive innovation through advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and machine learning solutions‚Äîturning complex data into real business outcomes at scale. If you thrive in dynamic environments, love mentoring others, and have a strong technical and strategic mindset, we want to hear from you.




A typical day

Lead the development and deployment of scalable machine learning solutions and advanced analytics for high-impact use cases.
Act as a thought partner to senior business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage data science for strategic initiatives.
Drive the design, implementation, and evaluation of experimentation frameworks, including A/B testing and causal inference.
Own and refine production-grade scoring models, recommendation systems, and automation tools.
Mentor and provide technical leadership to mid-level and junior data scientists.
Oversee the full lifecycle of data science projects‚Äîfrom ideation to deployment and monitoring.
Champion best practices in model development, testing, and ML Ops pipelines.
Proactively collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineering, product, and operations to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Serve as a subject matter expert in external engagements or cross-team collaborations.
Evaluate and introduce new technologies, methodologies, and tools that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible.
Translate complex data findings into clear, compelling business narratives for technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What you need to succeed

MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field.
5+ years of experience in data science roles, preferably with team leadership or strategic project ownership.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with a strong ability to influence and drive decisions.
Proven experience leading end-to-end data science projects with measurable business outcomes.
Advanced expertise in Python.
Strong proficiency in SQL and data wrangling at scale.
Deep understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimentation.
Experience working in cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure), including infrastructure and deployment.
Solid grasp of software engineering best practices (version control, testing, CI/CD).
Experience with Docker, containerization, and orchestration tools.
Strong track record of mentoring and coaching team members.
Hands-on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including integration and fine-tuning.
Practical knowledge of MLOps frameworks and practices (e.g., model monitoring, CI/CD for ML).
Experience building and deploying APIs for machine learning applications.




Bonus Points For

Experience with Apache Airflow for orchestrating data and ML pipelines.
Familiarity with Model Context Protocol (MCP).
Knowledge of Agentic AI architectures.




About the recruitment process

Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure‚Ä¶




üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
üçè Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)
Show more
HTML:
Who we are

At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!


Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of Aon, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?


What you will do

We are seeking a seasoned and strategic Senior Data Scientist to join our high-impact Data Science team. This is a leadership-oriented role where you‚Äôll guide data initiatives that influence key decisions across product, sales, marketing, operations, and customer experience. You will partner with stakeholders to drive innovation through advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and machine learning solutions‚Äîturning complex data into real business outcomes at scale. If you thrive in dynamic environments, love mentoring others, and have a strong technical and strategic mindset, we want to hear from you.


A typical day

  • Lead the development and deployment of scalable machine learning solutions and advanced analytics for high-impact use cases.
  • Act as a thought partner to senior business leaders, identifying opportunities to leverage data science for strategic initiatives.
  • Drive the design, implementation, and evaluation of experimentation frameworks, including A/B testing and causal inference.
  • Own and refine production-grade scoring models, recommendation systems, and automation tools.
  • Mentor and provide technical leadership to mid-level and junior data scientists.
  • Oversee the full lifecycle of data science projects‚Äîfrom ideation to deployment and monitoring.
  • Champion best practices in model development, testing, and ML Ops pipelines.
  • Proactively collaborate with cross-functional teams including data engineering, product, and operations to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
  • Serve as a subject matter expert in external engagements or cross-team collaborations.
  • Evaluate and introduce new technologies, methodologies, and tools that push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible.
  • Translate complex data findings into clear, compelling business narratives for technical and non-technical stakeholders.


What you need to succeed

  • MSc or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data science roles, preferably with team leadership or strategic project ownership.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with a strong ability to influence and drive decisions.
  • Proven experience leading end-to-end data science projects with measurable business outcomes.
  • Advanced expertise in Python.
  • Strong proficiency in SQL and data wrangling at scale.
  • Deep understanding of statistical modeling, machine learning, and experimentation.
  • Experience working in cloud environments (Google Cloud, AWS, or Azure), including infrastructure and deployment.
  • Solid grasp of software engineering best practices (version control, testing, CI/CD).
  • Experience with Docker, containerization, and orchestration tools.
  • Strong track record of mentoring and coaching team members.
  • Hands-on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including integration and fine-tuning.
  • Practical knowledge of MLOps frameworks and practices (e.g., model monitoring, CI/CD for ML).
  • Experience building and deploying APIs for machine learning applications.


Bonus Points For

  • Experience with Apache Airflow for orchestrating data and ML pipelines.
  • Familiarity with Model Context Protocol (MCP).
  • Knowledge of Agentic AI architectures.


About the recruitment process

  • Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
  • Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the colleagues from the Data Science team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day life is and its responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Scientist as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
  • If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level and you will have a maximum of 7 days to complete it.
  • If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet one of our Heads of Data and Engineering, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.


Why CoverWallet

At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations! And just for good measure‚Ä¶


  • üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
  • ‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
  • üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
  • üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
  • üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform (BigPocket) on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
  • üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
  • üçè Great offices in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world‚Äôs largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America‚Äôs largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor‚Äôs Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).




About the Role:

Dow Jones is seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our AI Engineering Team. You will design, construct, and maintain machine learning pipelines tailored for various AI applications, particularly focusing on Natural Language Processing. Collaborating with our engineering team, you'll integrate machine learning models, optimize performance, and ensure effective real-world application of machine learning solutions.

As a key team member, you will be involved in every aspect of the data science project development process, from data analysis and model selection to building proofs of concept and refining pipelines. You will leverage your expertise in statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to derive insights from data, address the organization's needs, and deliver tangible value through actionable outcomes.




You Will:

Collaborate within the AI Engineering Team to maintain robust data pipelines supporting various ML models, focusing on information retrieval applications.
Analyze and clean large datasets to optimize reusable ML models.
Partner with stakeholders across the company to translate business requirements into technical solutions.
Utilize analytical skills for NLP modeling, algorithm selection, and POC development.
Develop data enrichment pipelines to enhance insights aligned with strategic objectives.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to address the organization's data-driven needs, managing significant volumes of structured and unstructured data.
Integrate diverse ML models into systems, ensuring interoperability and performance optimization.
Lead efforts to optimize ML model performance through data analysis and validation in real-world applications.
Stay updated on AI, ML, and NLP advancements, incorporating emerging trends into processes.




You Have:

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, or a related STEM field.
At least 3 years of industrial experience in a data science or machine learning engineering role.
Strong programming skills in Python and/or another high-level language commonly used in machine learning.
Experience with NLP and Machine Learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., PyTorch, HuggingFace, LangChain, spaCy, NLTK, scikit-learn, etc.).
Demonstrated understanding of various techniques for extracting structured data from unstructured sources, indicating expertise in information retrieval.
Familiarity with LLMs APIs for pre-processing, fine-tuning, and deploying models on cloud-based infrastructure.
Familiarity with cloud-based infrastructure and services (e.g., AWS, GCP, etc.).
Experience with version control systems such as Git.




Our Benefits:

Comprehensive Healthcare Plans for you and your family (paid by Dow Jones)
Extra paid Time Off (30 days of holidays/year)
Possibility to work remotely for 3 months/year (desplazamiento program)
One week of remote work per quarter
Meal benefit with Pluxee (171‚Ç¨/month on top of your salary)
Retirement Plans (Dow Jones will pay 2% of a members Pensionable Salary and match employee contribution up to a maximum of 3 %).
Comprehensive Insurance Plans
Well-being Resources (200 USD allowance per quarter, Classpass, etc.)
Education Benefits
Family Care Benefits & Caregiving Support
Subscription Discounts
Employee Referral Program

Show more

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to work closely with the ML and Product teams. The candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to influence Product & ML strategies.¬†
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance.
Develop dashboards and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the company.

Skills and requirements:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a Quantitative Field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science).
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to formulate questions, run analysis to articulate a recommendation.
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis and conclusions.
Strong knowledge and experience of statistical concepts and hypothesis testing.
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated, young and dynamic team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbecue, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we?




In OMNIOS we specialize in the implementation of Artificial Intelligence in process optimization and information processing. We partner with big companies from fast moving sectors accelerating and standardizing their decision making through our own NLP algorithms and dynamic dashboards that gather and filter the information they require.




Our goal is to reduce the time of search and analysis of information, allowing our customers to increase the efficiency and effectiveness of the decisions they make.




You would be joining a young team and working on fun and interesting projects from day one, having a real impact in the project and pushing the current limits of AI, natural language processing and analytics.




Your Mission




As Data Science you will have the opportunity to contribute to the development and implementation of advanced artificial intelligence and machine learning solutions, specializing in the analysis, modeling, and understanding of complex data to enhance the company‚Äôs NLP and LLM capabilities.




As a Data Scientist in OMNIOS you will:




Data Analysis and Modeling:





Design and build predictive data models and machine learning algorithms.





Data Processing and Cleaning:





Prepare and process large datasets for analysis and modeling.


Ensure data quality and resolve issues with missing or erroneous data.





AI Solutions Development:





Collaborate with software development and AI teams to integrate data models into product solutions.


Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in data science and machine learning.





Collaboration and Communication:





Work closely with other technical and business teams to understand and define data analysis needs.


Communicate complex findings clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders.





Innovation and Continuous Improvement:





Explore new techniques and tools to improve existing models.


Contribute to the development of best practices in data science within the organization.


Perform exploratory data analysis to understand trends, patterns, and key relationships.





It would be a fit if you have:





Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related fields.


Min. of 3 years of proven experience in data science roles, preferably in environments related to AI and NLP.


Strong knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R, and data analysis tools.


Experience with big data processing tools and machine learning platforms.


Strong analytical and quantitative skills, with attention to detail and accuracy.


Interpretation of data and results.


Ability to work in a dynamic and collaborative environment.





It woud be nice if you have:





Experience in machine learning projects.





What we offer?





The opportunity to lead pioneering projects in the field of artificial intelligence.


A dynamic and collaborative team in an agile work environment.


Continuous training and professional development opportunities.


Hybrid schedule: 3 days work form home and 2 days at the office.


25 vacation days.


Birthday day off.


Flexible schedule 38 hours per week:
¬∑ Check in from 8h to 10h/Check out from 16.30h to 18.30h.







¬∑ Friday 8h to 14h or 9h to 15h.




¬∑ July and August (35 hours per week).




¬∑ August 100% remote.




¬∑ Office in Barcelona center.





Flexible remuneration: restaurant and transport ticket, kindergarten check.

¬∑ July and August (35 hours per week).


¬∑ August 100% remote.


¬∑ Office in Barcelona center.



  • Flexible remuneration: restaurant and transport ticket, kindergarten check.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who We Are



Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world‚Äôs largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.







We are feeding the world‚Äôs curiosity!





Job Description



The Opportunity



As a Data Scientist at Cint you will have the opportunity to work alongside our Data Science and Analytics teams and collaborate with product and engineering teams to work on Identity and Data Solutions products. This includes vendor analysis and onboarding, establishing statistical methodology and modeling standards and development. The ideal candidate is a self-starter comfortable working with large datasets and knowledgeable in statistical and machine learning techniques, with an eagerness to learn and contribute to the development and validation of products that align Cint capabilities with the market.



What ou will do



Support research and discovery phase for new and existing products/models. The primary areas include Identity and Data Solutions.



Actively participate in the development and enhancement of our Identity Graph, utilizing statistical and machine learning techniques to improve accuracy.



Drive the onboarding and validation of new data vendors, by establishing statistical methodologies and conducting comprehensive analysis to ensure new data partners meet our quality standards.



Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights, with an emphasis on data quality and reliability.



Respond to ad hoc requests from internal teams and clients, performing analyses and producing summary results.



Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver on broader project goals.



Participate in developing methodologies, model validation, and maintenance and enhancement of existing statistical and machine learning models.



Support evaluation and validation of both internal and external products to ensure Cint‚Äôs success.



Communicate insights and recommendations through visualizations and presentations that will resonate with a wide range of audiences.





Qualifications



What we are looking for



Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Statistics, Quantitative Sciences, Data Science, Operations Research or other quantitative fields.



2 years of experience in a data science and analytics capacity, preferably in market research, or advertising analytics.



Ability to manipulate, analyze, and interpret large data sources independently.



Familiarity with core statistical concepts and techniques (e.g. properties of distributions, hypothesis testing, parametric/non-parametric tests, survey design, sampling theory, experimental design, regression/predictive modeling, stochastic modeling/simulation, and more).



Exposure to a variety of machine learning methods (clustering, regression, tree-based models, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.



Practical experience applying statistical and modeling techniques.



Strong analytical skills with a focus on data validation and accuracy.



Comfortable with learning new methods, tools, and techniques.



Able to complete assigned tasks independently while collaborating on overall project direction and broader project goals



Proficiency in Python (as it relates to statistical analysis and implementing Machine Learning models)



Bonus points if you have



Experience with Identity vendors



Experience in online survey methodologies



Experience in Identity graph methodologies



Ability to write and optimize SQL queries



Experience working with big data technologies (e.g. Spark)





Additional Information















Our Values



Collaboration is our superpower



We uncover rich perspectives across the world
Success happens together
We deliver across borders.

Innovation is in our blood



We‚Äôre pioneers in our industry
Our curiosity is insatiable
We bring the best ideas to life.

We do what we say



We‚Äôre accountable for our work and actions
Excellence comes as standard
We‚Äôre open, honest and kind, always.

We are caring



We learn from each other‚Äôs experiences
Stop and listen; every opinion matters
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.





More About Cint



We‚Äôre proud to be recognised in Newsweek‚Äôs 2025 Global Top 100 Most Loved Workplaces¬Æ, reflecting our commitment to a culture of trust, respect, and employee growth.





In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish ‚Äì the world‚Äôs largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region ‚Äì and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid ‚Äì a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.







Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)



Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world and the largest Demand Side Platform (DSP) based in Europe, with our revenues over +$100M and consistently growing +40% YoY over the past years.

Our mission is to continue to improve our ad-tech platform to help our clients achieve their programmatic advertising campaign goals, and we want to give our employees a job they‚Äôll love, where they will be challenged to improve results through real-life engineering and data analysis and where everyone‚Äôs implication has an impact.

Are you ready to be part of the new unicorn? Keep reading!

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated ML Engineer to integrate our MLOps team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Python coding and some knowledge of MLOps industry practices. The role also requires involvement in automation tasks for the ML team.¬†¬†

What will you do:

Design, implement, and maintain end-to-end pipelines for ML model deployment, monitoring, and lifecycle management.
Develop automated workflows for CI/CD in ML systems to ensure rapid and reliable deployments.
Implement robust monitoring and alerting systems for production ML models to ensure performance and reliability.
Develop and improve Python scripts responsible for algorithmic decision making, generating alarms, dashboards, reports.
Troubleshoot issues in real-time and ensure high availability of deployed systems.
Collaborate with the machine learning team (ML) to manage model retraining and updating processes.
Write, review and maintain high-quality Python code for MLOps tooling and automation.

What you need to have:

Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science
Proficiency in Python and familiarity with data related processing libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).
Good understanding of CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices
Strong Interest in machine learning topics
Experience in Linux environments
Fluency in English is mandatory
Possesses good communication skills both verbal and written
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.

Extra points for :-)

Familiarity with AWS services such as EMR, EC2, Athena, S3
Hands-on experience with ML workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, MLflow).
Experience with cloud platforms (preferable AWS) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes).

Reward package:

Integrate a highly motivated and young team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona in a penthouse office with rooftop terrace, Barbeque and fully stocked fridge
Good work-life balance: 2 days working from home, flexible hours
LinkedIn learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Tickets Restaurant monthly allowance¬†
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to the 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 40 countries!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About Us

We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.

As a trusted voice for many of the world‚Äôs most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.

About The Role

GreenPowerMonitor, a DNV company, is at the heart of global energy transformation. We use data-driven digital solutions to optimize the performance of renewable energy installations around the world. Our work contributes to a more diverse and sustainable global energy mix.

We are looking for a motivated and skilled Data Scientist to join our team and contribute to the support and development of data-driven solutions in the renewable energy sector. If you are passionate about data, fluent in Python, and experienced in statistics, time series analysis, and boosting techniques, we want to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities


Analyze time series data and perform data quality control for wind, solar, and storage technologies.
Apply statistical and machine learning techniques to uncover insights from complex datasets.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate analytical outputs into operational workflows.
Train and evaluate models with effective hyperparameter tuning and result validation to support business decisions.
Use Kubernetes to manage and deploy machine learning workflows in containerized environments.
Work with databases such as MongoDB, ClickHouse, and PostgreSQL, for data storage and processing.


This is a unique chance to apply your data science skills to real-world challenges in renewable energy. You'll work with advanced tools and technologies, contribute to impactful projects, and help accelerate the global shift toward a sustainable energy future.

What we offer

Our benefits package is specifically designed to support your physical, financial and social wellbeing:


Great atmosphere of working together with professionals and some of the most engaged and knowledgeable people in the industry.
Guidance from colleagues through coaching, mentoring and participating in international networks.
Numerous opportunities to advance your professional skills and technical expertise through individual competence development plans and tailored training.
Multiple country specific lifestyle benefits, including health insurance, pension plan, flexible work schedule, trainings, etc.
Be part of a world growing and renowned organization with origins dating back to 1864.


DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.

About You

To thrive and succeed, you have:


Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, or Computer Science.
Strong proficiency in Python, including libraries such as NumPy, Pandas and Scikit-learn.
Solid foundation in applied statistics, including the series analysis, clustering, distribution analysis, and hypothesis testing.
Practical experience with machine learning algorithms, especially clustering, regression and boosting methods (e.g. XGBoost, LightGBM, CatBoost).
Experience in hyperparameter tuning and model performance optimization.
Hands-on experience with time series modeling and analysis.
Working knowledge of databases such as MongoDB, ClickHouse, or PostgreSQL.
Proficient in Git for version control and collaborative development.


Will Be a Plus


Familiarity with AutoML tools to streamline model development.
Basic Knowledge of Kuberflow for orchestrating machine learning workflows.
Experience with cloud platforms (Kubernetes, AWS, Azure) and containerization tools like Docker is a plus.
Prior experience int he renewable energy domain is a strong advantage.
Deep learning techniques and frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch is a plus.


As a person, you demonstrate strong analytical thinking, curiosity, and a problem-solving mindset. You can work both independently and collaboratively, communicating complex finding clearly to nontechnical stakeholders. A high level of attention to detail, adaptability, and a passion for continuous learning are essential, especially in fast evolving environments like renewable energy. Strong teamwork, ownership, and a proactive attitude toward challenges and innovation are key to thriving in this role.

Security and compliance with statutory requirements in the countries in which we operate is essential for DNV. Background checks will be conducted on all final candidates as part of the offer process, in accordance with applicable country-specific laws and practices.

Title: AI ML Engineer
Description:
Descripci√≥n





Get ready. Because you‚Äôre about to embark on an AI mission to revolutionise small business and accounting practices.

Sage Copilot isn‚Äôt just an AI-powered tool. We‚Äôre developing a game changer. A tool that will help customers streamline their tasks, boost their efficiency, and unlock new opportunities. Making it a trusted business partner, the likes of which they‚Äôve never seen.

And you‚Äôll be at the forefront of its development, as part of a global team, who can‚Äôt wait to collaborate and innovate with you.

We‚Äôre working on a truly groundbreaking product. So, is this your next technology job? No‚Äîthat doesn‚Äôt do it justice. This is the future realised‚Äîfor you, for our customers, and for the shape of technology as we‚Äôve dreamed it.

We are seeking a talented and motivated A.I. Engineer to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will have experience in programming, artificial intelligence, machine learning and data science.

This is a hybrid role - three days per week in our Barcelona office.

Responsabilidades principales What you'll be doing:

Teamwork: work within a team to build and maintain cloud-based solutions to support Sage‚Äôs business plans and long-term objectives by contributing to our state-of-the-art cloud architecture.

Innovation and Technology: Leverage emerging technologies to innovate and improve the Sage Copilot implementation. Stay abreast of industry trends and incorporate best practices into the workstream.

Architecture and Framework: contribute to the architectural design and implementation of Sage Copilot, ensuring it meets scalability, security, and performance standards.

Collaborating: with external teams to integrate provided frameworks effectively.

Knowledge sharing: Share knowledge to help upskill wider teams on how AI technologies can be leveraged in our products. Foster a culture of continuous learning and development to ensure your skills remain cutting-edge.

Performance and Security: Monitor and optimize quality and performance whilst ensuring security protocols are followed.

Requirements:


Strong software engineering fundamentals and experience in designing, developing, and testing software applications.
Solid understanding of AI/ML principles and algorithms, particularly in areas relevant to Natural Language Processing and content generation.
Experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), including their architecture, capabilities, and limitations. Familiarity with platforms like AWS Bedrock (Anthropic Claude, etc.) is beneficial.
Proficiency in Python.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS) and related services.
Understanding of API design and development.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills to tackle complex technical challenges.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills in English to work effectively with diverse teams.
Curiosity and a passion for AI and innovation.






At Sage, we offer you an environment where you can grow professionally without compromising your personal well-being. Our benefits package is designed to provide stability, flexibility, and balance:


Flexible benefits: exchange part of your salary and make tax savings on health insurance, meal and transport vouchers, childcare, and training.
Well-being: Free access to the Calm app (for up to 5 users), 24/7 counseling, and emotional support from our Healthy Mind Coaches. We also offer self-care and parenting resources through the Cleo app.
Flexible working: flexibility of working one hour in, one hour out, shortened workdays on Fridays and during the summer, and the opportunity to work from over 40 countries for up to 10 weeks per year through our Work Away program.
Annual leave: 23 working days of vacation, 5 paid days per year for volunteering, and 5 additional paid days annually for personal or professional development.
Extended leave: 7 extra days of maternity leave and 5 extra days of paternity leave, on top of the legal allowance, available after one year of service.
Financial support: Life and disability insurance, salary advances of up to 3.5 times your net monthly pay, a ‚Ç¨300 net marriage bonus, and access to Sage's employee stock purchase plan at a discounted rate.






Health & Safety Responsibilities:


Fostering the safety culture leading by example.
Following established safety procedures and reporting potential hazards promptly helps maintain a secure and efficient workplace.
Participating in safety training sessions and adhering to preventive guidelines and procedures, the objective is minimizing risks and protecting yourself and the rest of your colleagues.

Title: ML Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
About The Job

We‚Äôre hiring ML Engineer to join our awesome and growing team. In this role, you will have the privilege of working on innovative projects in machine learning, utilising your expertise to develop impactful solutions. From conceptualisation to execution, you will play a pivotal role in leading and contributing to comprehensive projects.


Collect raw data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and data streams, ensuring accuracy and consistency through thorough cleaning.
Design/Develop/Integrate practical machine learning (ML) solutions across different industries and use cases to create robust ML systems.
Conduct machine learning tests and experiments.
Work closely with cross-functional teams (engineers, managers) to understand business requirements and develop data-driven solutions.
Stay updated with the latest developments in data science and machine learning.
Participate in agile SCRUM teams for tool and prototype development.



About the job:


A degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related field is required. A master‚Äôs degree in data science is a plus.
Professional working experience in the field.
Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and techniques.
Working experience with LLMs and related techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Excellent communication in English and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Software skills are highly desirable.



Benefits:


Competitive salary
Flexible work schedule and remote work options
+2 days extra off (Christmas and NYE)
Travel budget to explore Munich and/or Barcelona
Company-sponsored social events, (e.g., team-retreats in Mallorca, Italy) and team-building activities (e.g., yearly Christmas hackathon)
Opportunities for growth and advancement within MVST (e.g., ‚Ç¨1.500 on top, sponsored Udemy courses)
Free language courses
Home office budget
Sponsored gym membership
Digital vouchers for meals and (public) transport tickets
Monthly company breakfast and lunch
Free coffee, water, fresh fruits and snacks, granola bar for breakfasts
Show more

From conceptualisation to execution, you will play a pivotal role in leading and contributing to comprehensive projects.

  • Collect raw data from various sources such as databases, APIs, and data streams, ensuring accuracy and consistency through thorough cleaning.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Location: Barcelona, in-office

At SumUp, we are passionate about giving access to financial services to the millions

of businesses too small for most providers to consider.

What started as one card reader has turned into a range of readers and multiple remote payment solutions, as well as banking services, including Business Accounts and Loans.

As a Data Scientist in the Lending Tribe, you will play with a huge dataset with billions of transactions from millions of active users. From there, you will build impactful models to help businesses across multiple countries get access to credit through SumUp‚Äôs different lending products. You‚Äôll be part of a team of talented analysts, engineers, and other scientists using an advanced stack of tools to create innovative solutions for our products.

What You Will Do


Improve the core lending models: credit risk scoring and affordability forecasting models using machine learning solutions
Define data collection strategies and new algorithms for models to support expansion to new market segments
Perform analyses and present your insights to enable SumUp business teams to make data-driven, mission-critical decisions (DROP)
Communicate and present results to product and business stakeholders
Mentor other Data Scientists to pursue data science excellence through good engineering practices
Build production-grade ML solutions using Python, scikit-learn, LightGBM, and PySpark‚Äîdelivered with testing, monitoring, and reproducibility baked in
Navigate and improve legacy code and pipelines‚Äîrefactor without fear, stabilise what‚Äôs brittle, and raise engineering standards across the board
Clearly communicate trade-offs and model performance to both technical and business stakeholders


You will be great for this position if you have:


Solid understanding of Data Science
Deep Python skills, including experience with (pandas, scikit-learn)
Solid SQL knowledge
Mastery of statistics, machine learning, and probability theory
Proven track record in delivering solutions end-to-end
Experience deploying machine learning models and artifacts in production at scale
Excellent technical reading, writing and communication skills to support stakeholder management


Big Plus


Hands-on experience building or maintaining credit risk models in regulated environments
A background in software engineering‚Äîyou think in modules, write testable code, and care about long-term maintainability
Experience launching models in data-constrained or new market environments
A degree in a quantitative field: Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or similar


Why You Should Join SumUp


Opportunity to work with SumUppers globally on large-scale fintech products used by millions of businesses worldwide, from our Berlin office. This involves an office-first setup
Restaurant tickets (powered by Edenred)
Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion: Be part of a workplace that values and promotes diversity, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone's perspectives are respected and embraced
A dedicated annual L&D budget of ‚Ç¨2000 for attending conferences and/or advancing your career through further education
30 Days Sabbatical: Enjoy the unique opportunity to take a well-deserved break with our 30 days sabbatical benefit after completing 3 years of employment with SumUp
Referral Bonus: Earn additional rewards by referring talented individuals to join the SumUp team


About SumUp

We believe in the everyday hero.

Small business owners are at the heart of all we do, so we create powerful, easy-to-use financial solutions to help them run their businesses. With a founder‚Äôs mentality and a 'team-first‚Äô attitude, our diverse teams across Europe, South America and the United States work together to ensure that the small business owners we partner with can be successful doing what they love.

SumUp is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. SumUp does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, colour, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age or any other basis protected by applicable laws or prohibited by company policy. SumUp also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind.

SumUp will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate.

Job Application Tip

We recognise that candidates feel they need to meet 100% of the job criteria in order to apply for a job. Please note that this is only a guide. If you don‚Äôt tick every box, it‚Äôs ok too because it means you have room to learn and develop your career at SumUp.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
NDT Global is the leading provider of ultra-high-tech diagnostic inspection solutions, advanced data analysis and integrity assessment services for ensuring the safety and longevity of energy-sector infrastructure assets. Recognized as the forerunner in ultrasonic inspection technologies comprising Pulse Echo, Pitch-and-Catch and Phased Array, as well as Acoustic Resonance (ART Scan) methodologies, the company also deploys a range of non-ultrasonic technologies, such as Inertial Measurement Units, with more under development. NDT Global strategically applies its inspection technologies to detect, diagnose and model various types of threat‚Äîcircumferential or axial cracks, metal loss, geometry, mapping, and more‚Äîacross diverse classes of assets. By providing predictive, decision-ready insights driven by the world‚Äôs most accurate data, NDT Global enables the conditions for asset owners to optimize infrastructure health and drive operational efficiencies while reducing risk and minimizing their carbon footprint.

Purpose

The goal of the Data Scientist is to improve accuracy and efficiency of data analysis through the research and implementation of data-driven algorithms and methodologies.

Responsibilities


Researches and implements prototypes for improving data analysis accuracy and/or efficiency
Tests and performs statistical analysis to evaluate developed solutions
Ensures quality of the developed prototypes by software testing and/or code reviews
Writes documentation of developed solutions and ensures knowledge transfer
Keeps up to date with development practices in the industry
Supports daily business with short-notice feasibility studies or data fixes
Other duties as assigned



Qualification And Work Experience


A bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, Natural Sciences or Mathematics is required
A master's degree in computer science, Engineering, Natural Sciences or Mathematics is preferred
A PhD in Computer Science, Engineering, Natural Sciences or Mathematics is preferred
2 years of work experience in similar roles
Experience working contributing to research and/or data science projects
Advanced knowledge on statistical analysis and high abstraction and synthesis level
Experience in scientific programming and data analysis
Knowledge in Data Science and Machine Learning (feature engineering, supervisors and unsupervised learning)
Experience communicating with experts and non-experts on scientific problems and results
Advanced programming skills in python



Skillset


Must be proficient in spoken and written English, local language is a plus
Excellent problem-solving skills and a curious mindset
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in a team environment.
Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and methodologies.
Friendly and approachable demeanor, fostering a positive work environment.
Passion for data science and a genuine interest in exploring new ideas and concepts



Benefits


Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package: Health Insurance, pension Plan, Gym Flex, eyecare, 23 days Annual leave
Flexible & Hybrid working: Our flextime model allows you to design your working day as it suits your needs
We think about the future: Individual training and development opportunities and professional development schemes
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact on our data strategy
International, intercultural and young working environment.
Great company culture and office environment
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 23 countries.

Together we revolutionise the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

We are looking for a talented and passionate Data Scientist to join the Lifecycle Data team in our Barcelona HQ.

Data Science, Machine Learning, and Experimentation are key drivers of Glovo‚Äôs customer engagement strategy. Data scientists at Lifecycle own some of the most impactful models and insights that optimize Glovo‚Äôs user retention and loyalty. This includes churn prediction models, customer segmentation, lifetime value modeling, and personalized recommendation engines. As a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to work on projects that directly impact Glovo‚Äôs ability to maximize user engagement, retention, and overall lifetime value.

THE JOURNEY


Develop, test, and productionize predictive and prescriptive algorithms using state-of-the-art machine learning, statistical inference, and optimization models.
Evaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g., cross-validation) and online experiments (e.g., A/B testing, uplift modeling).
Contribute to one or more of the following areas: churn prediction, customer segmentation, lifetime value modeling, and personalized recommendations.
Design and implement experiments to measure the effectiveness of lifecycle initiatives, providing actionable insights to product and marketing teams.
Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, growth, and CRM, amongst others.
Stay on top of new technologies and industry trends in data science, customer analytics, and retention strategies.
Promote best-in-class standards, taking inspiration from industry thought leaders.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, statistical modeling, causal inference, customer analytics, time series analysis, and optimization.
Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:
Strong data modeling and SQL skills.
Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).
Extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.
Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.
Working knowledge of agile development.
Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and non-experts alike.

Good To Have


Experience in applying Data Science techniques to customer retention, engagement, and lifecycle optimization.
Experience working with CRM data, A/B testing frameworks, and customer segmentation tools.
At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.


Even if it seems you don't meet our musts, don‚Äôt let it stop you! We are all about finding the best talent out there. Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves


üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

  • Design and implement experiments to measure the effectiveness of lifecycle initiatives, providing actionable insights to product and marketing teams.
  • Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, growth, and CRM, amongst others.
  • Stay on top of new technologies and industry trends in data science, customer analytics, and retention strategies.
  • Promote best-in-class standards, taking inspiration from industry thought leaders.

What You Will Bring To The Ride

  • Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at least one of the following areas: traditional machine learning, statistical modeling, causal inference, customer analytics, time series analysis, and optimization.
  • Extensive experience with the end-to-end predictive/prescriptive model development cycle, from problem definition to productionalization and maintenance. This includes:
    • Strong data modeling and SQL skills.
    • Familiarity with orchestration tools (Airflow, Luigi, Dagster) and cloud infrastructures (GCP, AWS, Azure).
    • Extensive experience using the Python ML and DS ecosystem.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication in English, as you will use it to collaborate with stakeholders and senior management from diverse backgrounds.
  • Working knowledge of agile development.
  • Change management skills and adaptability in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and non-experts alike.
Good To Have

  • Experience in applying Data Science techniques to customer retention, engagement, and lifecycle optimization.
  • Experience working with CRM data, A/B testing frameworks, and customer segmentation tools.
  • At least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.

Even if it seems you don't meet our musts, don‚Äôt let it stop you! We are all about finding the best talent out there. Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

Individuals representing diverse profiles, and abilities, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable.

We Believe Driven Talent Deserves

  • üåü An enticing equity plan that lets you own a piece of the action.
  • üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
  • üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
  • üí≥ Discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
  • üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
  • üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
  • üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
  • üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.

Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

We are looking for a dedicated and creative Data Scientist to join the Product Development team in Catalog Games! You will help shape the future of our games through deep data insights that unlock player behaviors and business opportunities. As part of a diverse and talented analytics community, you‚Äôll support multiple teams in creating entertaining, data-driven experiences for millions of players.

Working closely with game designers, producers, and other data scientists, you will define experiments, drive actionable insights, and continuously evolve how we understand and enhance our games.

Key Responsibilities:


Design, analyze, and present results from A/B tests to inform feature and game development.
Proactively conduct data explorations and develop models that uncover new opportunities.
Deliver clear and impactful visualizations and presentations tailored to diverse audiences.
Ensure data quality and accessibility to support informed decision-making across teams.
Support the evolution of Catalog Games‚Äô data science methodologies and tooling.
Collaborate across games to share insights, tools, and learnings that benefit the broader portfolio.
Systematically break down abstract problems into concrete analytical questions.


Skills To Create Thrills

Analytical & Technical:


Advanced proficiency in SQL for working with large-scale datasets (300M+ players).
Skilled in Python or R for statistical analysis and modeling.
Deep understanding of statistical methodologies, including A/B testing and experimental design.
Experience with big data tools (e.g., BigQuery, AWS, Hadoop).
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).


Business & Communication:


Strong business insight: able to frame product questions into structured analyses.
Effective communicator: present data stories clearly and influence diverse stakeholders.
Collaborative mindset: ability to work cross-functionally and guide decision-making.


Tasty Bonus Skills


Background in behavioral psychology, game theory, or predictive modeling.
Experience with in-game advertising or mobile game analytics.
Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git), and experience in collaborative programming.
Familiarity with additional languages such as Java or scripting for automation.
Contributions to data science communities or internal capability-building initiatives.


About King

With a mission of Making the World Playful, King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world‚Äôs most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as Farm Heroes Saga. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malm√∂, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king_games on X.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We‚Äôre seeking an ML/AI Engineer who‚Äôs excited by the opportunity to turn data into action and help shape the future of AI-driven products in a dynamic environment. You'll work on a mix of mature machine learning systems and emerging areas such as Generative AI, RAG, and agentic AI, as we begin to explore their potential to support internal tools and user-facing features.

This role offers a chance to deploy ML models in a production-ready ML system and also be part of the team that is starting to experiment and trying to integrate next-generation AI capabilities into our ecosystem. You‚Äôll work alongside ML practitioners while having space to explore, prototype, and learn.

What You'll Do


Deploy machine learning models that support game features, player experience, and operational efficiency.
Enhance the code quality of others' work by refining SQL and Python scripts for data transformation, feature engineering, modelling pipelines, and AI app, thereby ensuring production readiness.
Explore and contribute to early-stage projects involving LLMs, RAG systems, and agentic AI to power new types of automation and decision support.
Develop or refine Streamlit-based tools (or alike), that present ML/AI capabilities to non-technical users via intuitive and interactive interfaces.
Help design and implement model monitoring systems to ensure long-term performance and business alignment.
Collaborate with teams across product, data, and engineering to identify where ML and AI can bring value.
Communicate results, limitations, and recommendations clearly across technical and business collaborators.


What We're Looking For


5+ years of experience applying machine learning to real-world problems, from data to deployment.
Strong Python skills and hands-on experience with ML Python libraries.
Solid SQL expertise and experience working with large data warehouses.
Comfort working with cloud platforms (e.g., GCP, AWS, Azure), Docker, and Airflow.
Ability to build simple user interfaces (e.g., Streamlit) to expose ML models or AI applications to wider teams.
Hands-on experience building applications with Generative AI (LLMs), including API integration.
Interest or early experience in RAG systems‚Äîwhether through prototypes, side projects, or professional work.
Interest or familiarity with agentic AI concepts or frameworks (e.g., LangChain agents, CrewAI,..) is a plus, but not a must.
Curiosity, initiative, and a desire to learn and grow in a fast-evolving space.
Degree in a relevant technical field or equivalent experience.


Why Aristocrat?

Aristocrat is a world leader in gaming content and technology, and a top-tier publisher of free-to-play mobile games. We deliver great performance for our B2B customers and bring joy to the lives of the millions of people who love to play our casino and mobile games. And while we focus on fun, we never forget our responsibilities. We strive to lead the way in responsible gameplay, and to lift the bar in company governance, employee wellbeing and sustainability. We‚Äôre a diverse business united by shared values and an inspiring mission to bring joy to life through the power of play.

We aim to create an environment where individual differences are valued, and all employees have the opportunity to realize their potential. We welcome and encourage applications from all people regardless of age, gender, race, ethnicity, cultural background, disability status or LGBTQ+ identity. EEO M/F/D/V


World Leader in Gaming Entertainment
Robust benefits package
Global career opportunities


Our Values


All about the Player
Talent Unleashed
Collective Brilliance
Good Business Good Citizen


Travel Expectations

None

Additional Information

Depending on the nature of your role, you may be required to register with the Nevada Gaming Control Board (NGCB) and/or other gaming jurisdictions in which we operate.

At this time, we are unable to sponsor work visas for this position. Candidates must be authorized to work in the job posting location for this position on a full-time basis without the need for current or future visa sponsorship.
