Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Description

Are you a data scientist who thrives on solving real business challenges with smart, data-driven solutions? Would you like to be part of a fast-growing Data Platform & Digital Team in a Company awarded as a Great Place to Work? If so, we want you on our team!

We are looking for a Data Scientist who is thrilling for designing and implementing advanced analytics and machine learning models that support a wide range of business use cases.

Why Epta?

At Epta, we are shaping the future of commercial refrigeration through innovation and technology. We are welcoming all candidates who have a great desire to have a real impact across our global organization. At Epta, you‚Äôll be at the heart of our AI initiatives‚Äîdesigning, building and deploying intelligent systems.

Key Responsibilities


Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand challenges and translate them into data science solutions.
Design and develop predictive and prescriptive models using statistical and machine learning techniques.
Build prototypes and production-ready pipelines, integrating with cloud services (preferably AWS).
Apply rigorous experimentation and evaluation methodologies to ensure model performance and reliability.
Contribute to the development of scalable, maintainable ML architectures with awareness of MLOps principles.
Proficient in leveraging cutting-edge generative AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT, DALL¬∑E, and Midjourney) to streamline workflows, drive innovation, and deliver high-impact content solutions.
Stay up to date on emerging tools, frameworks, and trends‚Äîespecially in the field of generative AI‚Äîand bring that knowledge into projects.
Document solutions and present findings in a clear, structured, and impactful manner to technical and non-technical audiences.



Preferred Requirements


Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, or a related STEM field.
2+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or similar role.
Solid foundation in mathematics and statistics (e.g. probability, linear algebra, optimization).
Proficiency with Python and common ML libraries (e.g. scikit-learn, XGBoost, PyTorch, TensorFlow).
Hands-on experience in developing models in cloud environments (preferably AWS: SageMaker, Bedrock, Lambda, etc.).
Familiarity with MLOps practices and tools (e.g. CI/CD for ML, model monitoring).
Exposure to generative AI tools or projects (e.g. LLMs, embeddings, RAG pipelines).
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking abilities.
Ability to work independently and cross-functionally in a collaborative environment.
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.



What Sets Us Apart

At Epta, we believe our employees are the driving force behind our success. That‚Äôs why we offer a thoughtful range of perks designed to inspire, support, and celebrate our team every step of the way.


We take development opportunities seriously! Take part in a variety of training through our Epta Academy and external training partners.
Help make the world a better place and take part in our neverending volunteering activities.
Epta offers the opportunity for hybrid work, along with providing the necessary technical equipment.
Balance work and personal life perfectly with our flexible working hours.



Our story

We at the Epta Group are a dynamic and growing international company, delivering cutting-edge commercial refrigeration solutions that impact everyday life‚Äîfrom ensuring fresh food in supermarkets to keeping the perfect chill in your favorite caf√©. Our global network includes manufacturing facilities, sales entities and service organizations ‚Äîall working together to provide sustainable and innovative solutions. We support customers in their green transition and support them as a fully integrated provider, from the layout of the store to the after-sales support.

With over 8,000 employees, Epta fosters an environment of continuous development. We offer career growth, extensive training, and the opportunity to thrive in a company where every challenge is a chance to create value and inspire our people. Guided by our values, we are committed to professional excellence, sustainability, and innovation in every aspect of our work.

We welcome applications from all individuals, regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, disability, parental status, or social origin. At Epta, your unique perspective is what keeps us innovative and cool. Learn more about diversity & Inclusion at Epta HERE .

Step into something fresh‚Äîapply to be part of Epta‚Äôs dynamic team!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). We are a fully transparent platform built with top technology, countless programmatic management features and powerful machine learning algorithms to help advertisers grow their business at scale. We are currently considered one of the top mobile ad-tech companies in the world.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to work closely with the ML and Product teams. The candidate should be communicative and analytical, in order to answer the complex questions that Product and Campaign performance are facing. For this purpose we use tons of data available to get powerful insights to resolve them, creating effective strategies to help improve the Smadex platform!¬†

This is a full-time position based in Barcelona.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

Analyze large, complex data sets containing the behaviour of millions of mobile users and Apps worldwide to influence Product & ML strategies.¬†
Working cross-functionally with business and technical teams to support product performance.
Develop dashboards and processes to ensure data influences decisions at all levels of the company.

Skills and requirements:

3+ years of experience as a Data Scientist.
Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a Quantitative Field (Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science).
Strong problem-solving skills, ability to formulate questions, run analysis to articulate a recommendation.
Proven working knowledge of Python, SQL and large data sets, understanding of analytic methodologies for data evaluation.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present analysis and conclusions.
Strong knowledge and experience of statistical concepts and hypothesis testing.
Knowledge of the ad-tech industry is a plus.

Please note that we do NOT provide VISA sponsorship. Candidates without a legal permit to work in Spain won't be considered.

What is in it for you:

Integrate a highly motivated, young and dynamic team
Great compensation package
Top location at the heart of Barcelona with a rooftop terrace, Barbecue, and a fully stocked fridge
Great work-life balance: work from home (2 days per week), flexible hours
LinkedIn Learning and training opportunities
Meal vouchers - Ticket Restaurant monthly allowance
Monthly gym allowance to use in up to 30 DIR gyms around the city
Monthly TGIF events
Regular team-building events
Fun and friendly work environment with talented marketers and engineers from over 28 countries
And more!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¬°Hi! ¬°We are Cheil Spain! üöÄ




We are looking for an Account Director to lead and develop campaigns for our clients. The work is developed for Spain and Portugal, and we are seeking someone with a clear strategic and business vision to help us grow and expand our operations.




‚úîÔ∏è Your role at Cheil: Data Scientist




We are seeking a Data Scientist with strong expertise in building predictive models, performing advanced statistical analysis, and generating actionable insights to support ecommerce growth. The ideal candidate will be highly proficient in data science methodologies and comfortable working across the full data lifecycle ‚Äî from engineering pipelines to delivering strategic recommendations through data storytelling. This role requires experience with cloud platforms, advanced analytics tools, and the ability to translate business needs into data-driven solutions.




‚úîÔ∏è ¬øWhat will be your challenges and responsibilities at Cheil? ¬øWhat do we expect from you?




End-to-End Data Science Workflow: Lead the full data science lifecycle ‚Äî from data ingestion, wrangling, and modeling to insight generation and presentation.
Data Infrastructure & Engineering Collaboration:
Understand and map internal and external data sources, assessing data structure, accessibility, and quality.
Build and maintain data pipelines using Spark (in Python or Scala) and orchestrate jobs with Airflow.
Work with BigQuery and other GCP tools to manage cloud-based storage and processing efficiently.
Monitor pipeline performance, data quality, and cloud cost optimization.
Advanced Analytics & Statistical Modeling:
Design and deploy models for predictive analytics (e.g., sales forecasting, customer segmentation, time-series analysis).
Apply statistical methods to interpret business trends, quantify impact, and optimize decision-making.
Evaluate and improve model accuracy and performance over time.
Visualization, Dashboards & Reporting:
Translate complex insights into clear, visually compelling dashboards using Looker Studio (preferred), Tableau, or Power BI.
Build campaign and initiative-specific dashboards to support marketing, ecommerce, and strategic reporting needs.
Present data stories and recommendations to business stakeholders, including non-technical audiences.
Tooling & Development Environment:
Work in modern development environments with version control (Git) and collaborative workflow tools.
Develop and document scalable, reusable code and data models using tools like Python, SQL, and Spark.
Understand and apply best practices in cloud computing, IAM, and task orchestration.
Cross-functional Collaboration & Business Alignment:
Partner with ecommerce, marketing, CRM, and product teams to define analytical goals and translate them into data solutions.
Ensure alignment between data projects and business KPIs, proactively identifying high-impact use cases.
Drive data literacy within the team by sharing documentation, code, and insights with other departments.
Strategic Data Planning:
Identify ‚Äúquick win‚Äù opportunities to demonstrate data science impact in the short term.
Help define initial OKRs for the Data Science function and participate in roadmap discussions for long-term initiatives.
Stay up to date with industry best practices and emerging technologies to continuously elevate our data maturity.




‚úîÔ∏è Requirements:




3‚Äì5 years of experience in Data Science, Predictive Modeling, or Advanced Analytics, ideally in ecommerce, digital marketing, or agency environments.
Strong expertise in Python (Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn, etc.) and SQL (preferably with BigQuery).
Proven experience building and deploying data models for segmentation, forecasting, and pattern detection.
Experience designing and maintaining data pipelines with Spark (in Python or Scala).
Knowledge of task orchestration tools like Airflow and version control systems like Git.
Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (preferably Google Cloud Platform) for data storage, processing, and compute scalability.
Strong understanding of relational and non-relational databases, and ability to optimize data extraction and queries.
Experience building interactive dashboards and reporting tools with Looker Studio, Tableau, or Power BI.
Understanding of data quality, governance, and cost monitoring in cloud architectures.
Ability to communicate complex technical outputs to non-technical stakeholders with clarity and structure.




‚úîÔ∏è We would like you to bring together attitudes that have to do with...




Working effectively with individuals of diverse cultures, interpersonal styles, abilities, motivations, or backgrounds.
Making the most effective use of the capabilities, insights, and ideas of all individuals.
Inspiring others by generating innovative solutions in work situations .
Trying different and novel ways to deal with work problems and opportunities.
Working effectively and cooperatively with others.
Establishing and maintaining good working relationships.
Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment.
Tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals by proactively confronting difficult issues.
Establishing and sustaining trusting relationships by accurately perceiving and interpreting one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô emotions and behavior.
Leveraging insights to effectively manage one‚Äôs own responses and reactions.




‚úîÔ∏è Cheil offers you:




üå±Work in a growing environment, focused on creating and innovating with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams in Creativity, Digital Performance, Retail, Data and Technology.

‚úçÔ∏èStable position: Permanent contract because we want you to be part of Cheil and be able to develop with us.

üí∏Salary: To be negotiated based on experience. Bonus Performance.

üìñInternal training opportunities.

‚ù§Ô∏èSocial Benefits: Restaurant Tickets and Medical Insurance.

üïõTimetable from Monday to Thursday from 09.00-18.15 and Fridays from 09.00-15.00. July and August, we have an intensive working day, Monday to Friday from 8:00 - 15:00.

üíªHybrid working model.

üèñÔ∏è22 days of annual leave, plus 24 and 31 December and Advertising Day.

üí∞Possibility of incentive for attracting new clients and new employees to Cheil. Help us to keep growing!

üìçWe are located in Alcobendas and we have a direct bus service, 100% free, with departures from Plaza Castilla, Chamart√≠n and Nuevos Ministerios to our offices.




‚úîÔ∏è Next steps:




Are you motivated by what you have just read? Join Cheil!

If you are passionate about the world of advertising and have experience leading teams, we invite you to send your CV and cover letter. We hope to have a high-level professional who will help us continue to grow in the market.

Title: Data Scientist Gen AI
Place: Pozuelo de Alarc√≥n, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Verisure Securitas Direct: ‚ÄúPersonas que protegemos personas‚Äù

At the forefront of the European market, Verisure Securitas Direct leads with its intelligent alarms, delivering exceptional services to over 5 million customers in 17 countries across Europe and Latin America. With a team of over 20,000 employees, we are dedicated to security and service excellence.

Professional Opportunity: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Generative AI

We are seeking a Senior Data Scientist specialized in Generative AI who will report directly to the Head Of AI & Advanced Analytics PortFolio Team (Marketing Cliente). Your mission will be to develop and optimize AI models, particularly LLMs and GenAI solutions, to address business needs using data from various sources. You will collaborate closely with IT for implementation, validation, monitoring, and maintenance, as well as with business units across different countries to ensure the practical application of AI-driven solutions.

We are looking for someone with a strategic vision, customer focus, and operational efficiency, capable of driving innovation in AI while effectively communicating insights and recommendations. If this sounds like you, join our exceptional team.

Requirements:

Education:

Bachelor's or master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields.

Experience:

Over 3 years of experience in Data Science, with proven experience in Generative AI.

Hands-on experience with RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), advanced prompting techniques, and fine-tuning of Large Language Models (LLMs).

Hard Skills:

Deep understanding of LLM architectures, including Transformer models (GPT, BERT, T5, etc.).
Experience in fine-tuning, customizing, and deploying LLMs on cloud platforms.
Expertise in RAG techniques to enhance model retrieval and response accuracy.
Strong knowledge of prompt engineering, prompt tuning, and optimization techniques.
Proficiency in AI orchestration frameworks such as LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar.
Solid programming skills in Python (experience with Hugging Face, TensorFlow, PyTorch is highly valued).
Strong knowledge of SQL for efficient data querying and preprocessing.
Hands-on experience in cloud-based AI solutions (AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, GCP Vertex AI).
Experience in real-time AI implementations and monitoring.
Knowledge of MLOps best practices for AI model deployment and lifecycle management.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Power BI, Streamlit, or similar) is desirable.
Experience in project management methodologies (Agile, Scrum) is desirable.
Advanced English (+C1); part of the work will be conducted in English (oral and written).

Soft Skills:

Strong teamwork and cross-functional collaboration skills.
Ability to lead and drive AI transformation projects across different countries.
Storytelling and communication skills to explain complex AI concepts to non-technical stakeholders, including senior management.
Highly analytical with strong problem-solving skills.
Innovative mindset with a passion for exploring new AI trends and technologies.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

If you are passionate about pushing the boundaries of Generative AI and working on cutting-edge projects that impact millions of customers, we want to hear from you!

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.

Title: Data Scientist - Production
Description:
Level: Manager:

Experience: 4+ years

Role Overview: The Data Scientist - Production ensures the efficient transition of machine learning models from exploration to production. Working closely with the UDP team, this role is responsible for deploying, maintaining, and evolving AI models, ensuring their reliability and scalability in production environments. The role also includes representing CCEP in third-party projects to ensure smooth handovers.

Key Responsibilities:


Deploy and maintain AI models in production, ensuring efficient refreshes as needed.
Collaborate with the UDP team to integrate machine learning solutions into production workflows.
Represent CCEP in third-party projects, ensuring smooth transitions post-handover.
Monitor model performance and address requests for maintenance and evolution.
Implement best practices in MLOps for scalable and reliable model deployment.


Qualifications:


Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
Experience in deploying and maintaining machine learning models in production environments.
Proficiency in Python, SQL, and cloud platforms (e.g., Databricks, Azure).
Strong understanding of MLOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines and model monitoring.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail

Title: Associate Data Scientist
Description:
What We're All About.

It isn't often you get to be part of a tech company that, since 2016, has been innovating the data analytics market in ways no-one else can. Our technology started out in FinTech, helping tackle serious criminal activity. Now, its potential is virtually limitless. Working at Quantexa isn't just intellectually stimulating. We're a real team. Collaborating and constantly engineering better and better solutions. We're ambitious, we think things through and we're on a mission to discover just how far we can go. Nearly half of our colleagues come from an ethnic or religious minority background. We're made up of people from 47 nationalities who speak over 20 languages. As a diverse mix of individuals, we make one big unstoppable team.

If our incredible culture sounds like you, we'd love you to join us.

Quantexa was built with a vision of enabling better decision making through better data-driven intelligence. years, 20 locations and 800+ employees later we recently gained "Unicorn" status and we still believe in our original Decision Intelligence platform. We've completed our first acquisition, combining Aylien's advanced AI and Natural Language Processing (NLP) into our Decision Intelligence Platform and reached Centaur status ($100M in ARR)

As an Associate Data Scientist, you'll be joining a team of experts in Data Science and Software engineering within Quantexa's Graph Data Science team. The team is continuously working on new and innovative products, helping our Tier 1 clients solve engineering and business problems in the area of fraud, compliance and financial crime. In particular, the team focusses on using graphs (connected views of our data) to add context to our decision making. This includes the use of Knowledge Graphs; Graph Machine Learning and Graph analysis.

You'll be involved in:


Building analytics tools to detect risk and opportunities in Quantexa data
Building analytical pipelines for solving graph problems
Improving our analytical tooling to help with tasks such as statistical analysis, reporting
Developing and improving on existing/new methodologies with a focus on ease of use and re-usability
Understanding common pain points on client deliveries and working to resolve these
Working with an expert team to deliver the products end to end up to general availability



Requirements


What you'll bring.


Demonstrated aptitude, potential, and ambition to grow in the field of data science.
Experience in building a machine learning model from scratch, with the ability to present and explain the process and decision-making steps.
Academic background in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science (or related field), ideally with a 2:1 or First-class degree.
Proficiency in Python (or similarly complex programming language), which is the primary programming language used.



Nice to have.


Strong preference for candidates who have pursued data science personal projects or learning in their own time, demonstrating initiative and passion for the field of Data Science.
A basic understanding of graph theory and its main use cases.
Scala / Java
Experience using AI as a coding assistant (note this isn't an AI engineering role, but AI is used frequently within our work)
Experience in using graph libraries in python (or similar languages) e.g. NetworkX / igraph
An interest in software / data engineering
Experience with spark (either pyspark or the scala API)



Benefits


Why join Quantexa?

What makes you Q will help you to realize your full potential, flourish and enjoy what you do, while being recognized and rewarded with our broad range of benefits.


Competitive salary
Company bonus
23 days annual leave, plus national holidays + your birthday off!
Pension scheme with a company contribution of 5% (when you contribute 2%)
Private Healthcare with DKV
Life Insurance
Work from Home Allowance
Meal Vouchers
Regularly bench-marked salary rates
Well-being days
Volunteer Day off
Work from Home Equipment
Free Calm App Subscription #1 app for meditation, relaxation and sleep üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Continuous Training and Development, including access to Udemy Business
Spend up to 2 months working outside of your country of employment over a rolling 12-month period with our ‚ÄòWork from Anywhere' policy
Employee Referral Program
Team Social Budget & Company-wide Socials



Our mission.

We have one mission. To help businesses grow. To make data easier. And to make the world a better place. We're not a start-up. Not anymore. But we've not been around that long either. What we are is a collection of bright, passionate minds harnessing complexities and helping our clients and their communities. One culture, made of many. Heading in one direction - the future.

It's All About You.

It's important to us that you feel welcome, valued and respected. After all, it's your individuality and passion for what you do that will make you Q. We see that - which is why we're proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We've created and will continue to improve our inclusive and diverse work environment. Regardless of your race, beliefs, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, neurodiversity or ableness - whoever you are - if you are a passionate, curious and caring human being who wants to push the boundaries of what's possible, then we want to hear from you.

start. don't stop - Apply

  • Demonstrated aptitude, potential, and ambition to grow in the field of data science.
  • Experience in building a machine learning model from scratch, with the ability to present and explain the process and decision-making steps.
  • Academic background in Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science (or related field), ideally with a 2:1 or First-class degree.
  • Proficiency in Python (or similarly complex programming language), which is the primary programming language used.


Nice to have.

  • Strong preference for candidates who have pursued data science personal projects or learning in their own time, demonstrating initiative and passion for the field of Data Science.
  • A basic understanding of graph theory and its main use cases.
  • Scala / Java
  • Experience using AI as a coding assistant (note this isn't an AI engineering role, but AI is used frequently within our work)
  • Experience in using graph libraries in python (or similar languages) e.g. NetworkX / igraph
  • An interest in software / data engineering
  • Experience with spark (either pyspark or the scala API)


Benefits


Why join Quantexa?

What makes you Q will help you to realize your full potential, flourish and enjoy what you do, while being recognized and rewarded with our broad range of benefits.

  • Competitive salary
  • Company bonus
  • 23 days annual leave, plus national holidays + your birthday off!
  • Pension scheme with a company contribution of 5% (when you contribute 2%)
  • Private Healthcare with DKV
  • Life Insurance
  • Work from Home Allowance
  • Meal Vouchers
  • Regularly bench-marked salary rates
  • Well-being days
  • Volunteer Day off
  • Work from Home Equipment
  • Free Calm App Subscription #1 app for meditation, relaxation and sleep üßò‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
  • Continuous Training and Development, including access to Udemy Business
  • Spend up to 2 months working outside of your country of employment over a rolling 12-month period with our ‚ÄòWork from Anywhere' policy
  • Employee Referral Program
  • Team Social Budget & Company-wide Socials


Our mission.

We have one mission. To help businesses grow. To make data easier. And to make the world a better place. We're not a start-up. Not anymore. But we've not been around that long either. What we are is a collection of bright, passionate minds harnessing complexities and helping our clients and their communities. One culture, made of many. Heading in one direction - the future.

It's All About You.

It's important to us that you feel welcome, valued and respected. After all, it's your individuality and passion for what you do that will make you Q. We see that - which is why we're proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We've created and will continue to improve our inclusive and diverse work environment. Regardless of your race, beliefs, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, neurodiversity or ableness - whoever you are - if you are a passionate, curious and caring human being who wants to push the boundaries of what's possible, then we want to hear from you.

start. don't stop - Apply

Title: Machine Learning Engineers - Chat (DS2 - DS4)
Description:
About The Company

About Cleo

At Cleo, we're not just building another fintech app. We're embarking on a mission to fundamentally change humanity's relationship with money. Imagine a world where everyone, regardless of background or income, has access to a hyper-intelligent financial advisor in their pocket. That's the future we're creating.

Cleo is a rare success story: a profitable, fast-growing unicorn with over $200 million in ARR and growing over 2x year-over-year. This isn't just a job; it's a chance to join a team of brilliant, driven individuals who are passionate about making a real difference. We have an exceptionally high bar for talent, seeking individuals who are not only at the top of their field but also embody our culture of collaboration and positive impact.

If you‚Äôre driven by complex challenges that push your expertise, the chance to shape something truly transformative, and the potential to share in Cleo‚Äôs success as we scale, while growing alongside a company that‚Äôs scaling fast, this might be your perfect fit.

Follow us on LinkedIn to keep up to date with new product features and insights from the team.

About The Role

Machine Learning Engineers at Cleo work on building novel solutions to real-world problems. This really does vary but could be: creating chatbots to coach our users around their financial health, creating classifiers to better understand transaction data or even optimising transactions within our payments platform.

Ultimately, we‚Äôre looking for brilliant Machine Learning Engineers at Mid to Lead levels to join us on our mission to fight for the world's financial health. You‚Äôll be leading technical work within a team of adaptable, creative and product-focused engineers, who train & integrate cutting edge machine learning across a variety of products and deploy them into production for millions of users. We understand our customers, we understand their pain, and we are passionate about helping them.

What You'll Be Doing


Training and fine-tuning models to solve customer problems across our chatbot and the bank transaction data behind it.
Deploying these models into our production environments using our in-house ML platform, which you can read about on our blog: Let's have an Espresso: MLOps at Cleo. Or integrate with LLMs hosted by OpenAI, Anthropic, GCP, AWS and others.
Working cross-functionally with backend engineers, data analysts, UX writers, product managers, annotation teams, and others to ship features that improve our users‚Äô financial health.
Taking the initiative to propose & lead technical work towards problems that were previously unknown or poorly understood. Driving change at the chapter level that affects multiple squads.
Keeping Cleo at the forefront of NLP by driving the adoption of appropriate state-of-the-art techniques and communicating the team‚Äôs successes and learnings at the company level & beyond.
Mentoring & advising colleagues on their choices of models, architecture, and evaluation, promoting best practices for how we use LLMs.


Here Are Some Examples, Big And Small, Of The Kinds Of Product Feature Work Our ML Engineers Have Taken Part In Over The Last Year


Building AI Agents to explore and derive insights from users transactional data
Developed deeper understanding of users finances through models extracting meaning from transactional data. Think about your bank statement, how often do you not know what a transaction is?
Developed contextual intent classifiers to understand what conversations users are having with Cleo, enabling control of how Cleo should respond
Building ML models to understand the actions that users have available to them in Cleo and provide those contextually in conversations
Built ML models to understand the risk of customers using bank transaction features and user activity
Built models to optimise the payment success for our customers and optimising the costs for the business. Think of this as a two-sided optimisation problem.


Whatever problem you tackle, and whichever team you join, your work will directly impact those most in need, helping to improve their financial health.

What You'll Need


Experience in industry machine learning roles taking large scale ML products to production.
Excellent knowledge of both Data Science (python, SQL) and production tools
A deep understanding of probability and statistics fundamentals
Big picture thinking to correctly diagnose problems and productionising research
Top tier communication skills, to be able to partner with Product and Commercial Leaders
Industry-leading contributions to your field, communicated through conferences, blogs, talks, or open-source projects
Advanced Degree in a quantitative discipline or equivalent commercial experience


Nice to have


Strong experience with additional programming languages, such as Java, Scala, C++
Industry-leading contributions to your field, communicated through conferences, blogs, talks, or open-source projects


The recruitment process


Interview with a Recruiter (30 mins)
Interview with the Hiring Manager (30 mins)
Technical Interview (45-60 mins)
White-boarding session (60 mins)
Technical Discussion (60 mins)


What do you get for all your hard work?


A competitive compensation package (base + equity) with bi-annual reviews, aligned to our quarterly OKR planning cycles. You can view our public progression framework and salary bandings here: https://cleo-ai.progressionapp.com/
Work at one of the fastest-growing tech startups, backed by top VC firms, Balderton & EQT Ventures
A clear progression plan. We want you to keep growing. That means trying new things, leading others, challenging the status quo and owning your impact. Always with our complete support.
Flexibility. We can‚Äôt fight for the world‚Äôs financial health if we‚Äôre not healthy ourselves. We work with everyone to make sure they have the balance they need to do their best work
Work where you work best. We‚Äôre a globally distributed team. If you live in London we have a hybrid approach, we‚Äôd love you to spend one day a week or more in our beautiful office. If you‚Äôre outside of London, we‚Äôll encourage you to spend a couple of days with us a few times per year. And we‚Äôll cover your travel costs, naturally.
Company-wide performance reviews every 6 months
Generous pay increases for high-performing team members
Equity top-ups for team members getting promoted
25 days annual leave a year + public holidays (+ an additional day for every year you spend at Cleo, up to 30 days)
6% employer-matched pension in the UK
Private Medical Insurance via Vitality, dental cover, and life assurance
Enhanced parental leave
1 month paid sabbatical after 4 years at Cleo
Regular socials and activities, online and in-person
We'll pay for your OpenAI subscription
Online mental health support via Spill
Workplace Nursery Scheme
And many more!


We strongly encourage applications from people of colour, the LGBTQ+ community, people with disabilities, neurodivergent people, parents, carers, and people from lower socio-economic backgrounds.

App access for people in the UK & Europe: If you are an iOS user, please use this link to sign up to our TestFlight version of the app, so you can have a play around with the functionality and features: https://testflight.apple.com/join/fDG9hWng

By submitting this application, I confirm that all the information given by me in this application for employment and any additional documents attached hereto are true to the best of my knowledge and that I have not wilfully suppressed any material fact. I confirm I have disclosed if applicable any previous employment with CLEO. I accept that if any of the information given by me in this application is in any way false or incorrect, my application may be rejected, any offer of employment may be withdrawn or my employment with CLEO may be terminated summarily or I may be dismissed. By submitting this application, I agree that my personal data will be processed in accordance with CLEO's Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: AI Engineers - Madrid - Up to ‚Ç¨150k
Description:
AI Engineers - Madrid - Up to ‚Ç¨150k




Salaries - ‚Ç¨80 - 150k base + bonus

Location - Madrid

Must have a degree in Computer Science.




**Multiple headcount**




The client

Our client are a Joint Venture specialising in providing software development and consulting services to businesses operating in the Financial Services and Alternative Investment markets.




What Makes a Great Candidate

Theoretical understanding of Machine Learning fundamentals and knowledge on how to build real world ML systems.
Experience leveraging LLMs in production.
Knowledge of programming languages such as C# / .Net / Java / Python.
Exposure to cloud technologies such as AWS or Azure.
Ability to own aspects of an AI project.
A degree in Computer Science or a related field, ideally from a top global university.




If you are a passionate engineer, who enjoys solving challenging problems in a fast-paced environment then this could be a great fit. Join the team in Madrid to make a difference today.




Madrid - 5 days onsite

Salaries - ‚Ç¨80 - 150k base + bonus




AI Engineers - AI / LLM / MLOps / Python




If this is of interest please apply or reach out to will.semple@oliverbernard.com.

  • Experience leveraging LLMs in production.
  • Knowledge of programming languages such as C# / .Net / Java / Python.
  • Exposure to cloud technologies such as AWS or Azure.
  • Ability to own aspects of an AI project.
  • A degree in Computer Science or a related field, ideally from a top global university.


If you are a passionate engineer, who enjoys solving challenging problems in a fast-paced environment then this could be a great fit. Join the team in Madrid to make a difference today.


Madrid - 5 days onsite

Salaries - ‚Ç¨80 - 150k base + bonus


AI Engineers - AI / LLM / MLOps / Python


If this is of interest please apply or reach out to will.semple@oliverbernard.com.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com.

Job Description

You will achieve agreed Recurring revenue and New Business targets by developing new and repeat business opportunities from our customers. You will be also responsible for developing relationships with clients and connecting with main business executives and team members to communicate our value proposition. You will report to the Head of Analytics in EMAP

You'll Have Opportunity To


Achieve a total revenue target and a new business target.
Identify important contacts within existing accounts; cross selling and upselling accordingly.
Demonstrate an understanding of Experian's proposition and be experience communicating product benefits appropriate for each prospect this in the context of client/s needs.
Develop account plan to support revenue goals
Validate account plan with client, build and implement contact strategy.


Qualifications


Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Statistics, Mathematics or relevant field.
4+ years of experience.
Experience building and sustaining business relationships
Fluency in data, analytics and business process management
Experience expressing complex propositions regarding value


Benefits/Perks


Great compensation package and bonus plan
Core benefits including Experian shares discount and wellness program
Flexible work environment, hybrid model of teleworking
Flexible time off including volunteer time off, personal leaves and paid holidays


Additional Information

Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; World's Best Workplaces‚Ñ¢ 2024 (Fortune Top 25), Great Place To Work‚Ñ¢ in 24 countries, and Glassdoor Best Places to Work 2024 to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Product
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre MoonPay. We‚Äôre here to onboard the world to the decentralized economy.
Why?
Because crypto and blockchain aren‚Äôt just technologies‚Äîthey‚Äôre tools for global financial empowerment. They give people control over their money, their digital assets, and their future, unlocking opportunities that traditional systems have kept out of reach.

What We Do
At MoonPay, we‚Äôre building the infrastructure that powers this new financial system. We make it easy for anyone, anywhere, to buy, sell, and trade crypto using everyday payment methods like cards, Apple Pay, PayPal, Revolut and Venmo. We provide simple tools to send, receive, and manage stablecoins, so anyone can participate in the crypto economy confidently.

Trusted by nearly 30 million customers and over 500 companies, our secure, enterprise-grade platform is driving mainstream crypto adoption worldwide.

We collaborate with innovative brands and projects to build secure, scalable solutions for a blockchain-powered future. And we‚Äôre committed to doing it right‚Äîfully licensed in the U.S. and regulated across the UK, EU, Canada, and Australia‚Äîbecause trust and compliance are non-negotiable.

But we‚Äôre just getting started. We‚Äôve launched a consumer app that makes crypto accessible, intuitive, and usable for everyone, and it‚Äôs growing fast. We‚Äôre iterating every day to make it the best it can be.

If you believe financial freedom should be for everyone‚Äîif you believe in building a fairer, more open financial system‚Äîwe want you with us. To build systems that benefit all, we need contributions from all, regardless of background.

Come build the future of payments and the decentralized economy with MoonPay. Let‚Äôs make financial freedom and autonomy the new normal.
üåî About the Opportunity

We‚Äôre on the lookout for skilled Data Scientists to join our team at MoonPay. You‚Äôll be pivotal in driving business growth and maximizing our product performance. This is your chance to have a significant impact on our market-leading products, optimizing them and delivering actionable insights across the wider product organization. Join us and be part of an exciting journey to reshape the fintech and crypto industries!

üöÄ What you will do



Provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders based on a deep understanding of MoonPay products, and be able to identify and drive new opportunities for product improvements & enhanced customer experiences
Work closely with the product teams and business stakeholders to review product performance, look for opportunities to optimize our products, and deliver data driven strategies for increased product performance
Define KPIs, design tracking and set up monitoring for new product launches & changes
Oversee and implement A/B tests and other experiments to drive forward optimization efforts
Design, build and scale both internal and external data products, which drive informed decision making, examples include: dashboards, reports, data models, algorithms, integrations into other product lines
Communicate complex concepts and findings to technical and non-technical audiences across different teams, while ensuring clarity and understanding to drive critical business decisions





As a Product Data Scientist you will be expected to:


Independently lead projects from end-to-end
Prioritise and manage competing tasks and deadlines effectively, aligning with goals and adapting to changing priorities
Contribute to our overall approach and standards within the data discipline
Be proactive in spearheading initiatives to support stakeholders and business partners around the organisation





üßë‚ÄçüöÄ About You



2-5+ years of hands-on experience as a data scientist or data analyst, preferably in a product-focused role
Advanced SQL, data modelling, and data visualisation tools are second nature to you
You have an understanding of the fundamentals of statistics and probability, including experience in conducting large-scale A/B tests
You have experience working with product teams in an analytics role
An active interest in cryptocurrency, and have interacted with crypto/blockchains in the past
Experience working within the fintech and/or crypto space is preferred
You have the versatility and willingness to learn new technologies on the job and adapt quickly to changing priorities within a very dynamic environment
You are experienced in communicating with cross-functional stakeholders including product managers, engineers, and C-level executives





Bonus points if you have:


Worked with DBT, Google BigQuery, Looker and Python
Experience working in start-ups or scale-ups
Worked with blockchain data (e.g. explored on-chain activity through Dune, Flipside, or other tools)





We‚Äôre looking for people who live our core values, those who strive for excellence and want to leave a lasting legacy on the global financial system. Our values:

B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen

What‚Äôs in it for you

üí∞Competitive salary package

ü§ù Equity package: We believe financial freedom starts with our employees, so all employees have ownership at MoonPay

üìà Pay for performance equity bonus: Those who drive outsized outcomes receive outsized rewards

üèù Unlimited holidays: We give you the autonomy to choose when to work (and when to switch off)

üåç Hybrid working schedule: Work fully remotely or your nearest Moonbase, the choice is yours

ü©∫ Private Healthcare benefits: To protect you and your loved ones

üçº Enhanced parental leave: So you can spend more time with your loved ones without a second thought

üìö Annual training budget: We support your training journey every step of the way

ü™ë Home office setup allowance: Create the home office of your dreams

üëõ Remote working allowance: Those working fully remotely get a little extra for utilities

üí∞ Monthly budget to spend on our products and zero fee crypto transactions: Cultivate your inner DEGEN

üí∞ Employee referral programme: Great people know great people, refer them to receive 10K in USDC

‚úàÔ∏è Regular remote company offsites: Meet your colleagues regularly for high impact in person sessions and hackathons

üöÄ Working in a disruptive and fast-growing company where excellence is rewarded

What‚Äôs it like to work at MoonPay?

At MoonPay, you‚Äôll work alongside driven, resourceful people who are passionate about excellence in everything they do. Kaizen is more than just a saying here, it‚Äôs a mindset. We encourage you to think big, take risks, and push the boundaries of what‚Äôs possible, knowing you have the support of a team that wants to see you grow. We‚Äôre listed in the Sunday Times best places to work guide and consistently strive to provide an environment where everyone feels they can their best work.

Whether you‚Äôre remote or collaborating with teammates around the world, you‚Äôll find opportunities here to do the best work of your career while shaping the future of the decentralized economy.

Commitment To Diversity
Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and we‚Äôll do our best to provide assistance.

At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. That‚Äôs why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: Data Scientist Associate/Manager ‚Äì Analytics Transformation
Description:
¬øTe entusiasma hacer crecer tu carrera?

BBVA es una compa√±√≠a global con m√°s de 160 a√±os de historia que opera en m√°s de 25 pa√≠ses donde damos servicio a m√°s de 80 millones de clientes. Somos m√°s de 121.000 profesionales trabajando en equipos multidisciplinares con perfiles tan diversos como financieros, expertos legales, cient√≠ficos de datos, desarrolladores, ingenieros y dise√±adores.

Conoce m√°s sobre el √°rea:

La vacante estar√° activa en la web hasta el 18 de septiembre inclusive.*

GRM Data & Analytics is the Discipline, within the Global Risk Management function, responsible for the development of methodologies and models for risk measurement in the BBVA group. The analysis and use of new data sources and the implementation of the most advanced modelling techniques for risk purposes is the core activity of our team.

Sobre el puesto

Are you a Data Scientist looking for new opportunities? Would you like to join the company which is leading the financial sector transformation? Could you help us achieve our goal to become a Data Driven Company?

About the role, what you should know:

Based in Madrid, the successful candidate will join the Transformation CoE (Centre of Expertise) within the GRM Data & Analytics area, a spearhead of innovation within BBVA‚Äôs global holding, and will assume the leadership of data transformation projects in the development of Risk Modelling Innovation Lab, covering risk models, calibrations and capital/provisions calculations among other tasks.

This role will be central to BBVA‚Äôs strategic transformation of risk analytics, combining advanced modelling with automation, MLOps and GenAI to build scalable, modern solutions with direct impact across all geographies. It is an excellent opportunity for a talented individual who is keen to join a very ambitious and transformational project in a high performance team.

You will have access to state of the art tools, including GenAI solutions from OpenAI, Google Gemini and Microsoft Copilot, together with the full capacity of cloud infrastructure, enabling you to deliver next generation risk management solutions. As part of the transversal Advanced Analytics area, we provide a comprehensive training plan in machine learning and generative AI, developed in collaboration with the University of Navarra, Universidad Carlos III and BBVA‚Äôs internal programs. This is complemented by specialized training in finance, banking and regulatory knowledge.

In this role, the candidate will:


Define and develop new analytical modules in the modelling platform focused on the transformation towards new data, state of the art methodologies and the use of the most advanced algorithms to optimise decisions, tempos and performance in the Bank‚Äôs new analytical infrastructure.
Apply MLOps principles to automate and streamline the model lifecycle, including orchestration, versioning, deployment, and monitoring.
Take responsibility to ensure code quality, performance, usability and results are properly managed and maintained to support business objectives.
Research and Innovate integrating generative AI technologies to continue to be the spearhead in the sector and drive the modernization of risk management.
Structure and synthesise results to provide intuitive metrics and reportings to boost and optimise the decision process.
Manage dependencies and risks to ensure the successful implementation of the project.

La vacante estar√° activa en la web hasta el 18 de septiembre inclusive.*

GRM Data & Analytics is the Discipline, within the Global Risk Management function, responsible for the development of methodologies and models for risk measurement in the BBVA group. The analysis and use of new data sources and the implementation of the most advanced modelling techniques for risk purposes is the core activity of our team.

Sobre el puesto

Are you a Data Scientist looking for new opportunities? Would you like to join the company which is leading the financial sector transformation? Could you help us achieve our goal to become a Data Driven Company?

About the role, what you should know:

Based in Madrid, the successful candidate will join the Transformation CoE (Centre of Expertise) within the GRM Data & Analytics area, a spearhead of innovation within BBVA‚Äôs global holding, and will assume the leadership of data transformation projects in the development of Risk Modelling Innovation Lab, covering risk models, calibrations and capital/provisions calculations among other tasks.

This role will be central to BBVA‚Äôs strategic transformation of risk analytics, combining advanced modelling with automation, MLOps and GenAI to build scalable, modern solutions with direct impact across all geographies. It is an excellent opportunity for a talented individual who is keen to join a very ambitious and transformational project in a high performance team.

You will have access to state of the art tools, including GenAI solutions from OpenAI, Google Gemini and Microsoft Copilot, together with the full capacity of cloud infrastructure, enabling you to deliver next generation risk management solutions. As part of the transversal Advanced Analytics area, we provide a comprehensive training plan in machine learning and generative AI, developed in collaboration with the University of Navarra, Universidad Carlos III and BBVA‚Äôs internal programs. This is complemented by specialized training in finance, banking and regulatory knowledge.

In this role, the candidate will:

  • Define and develop new analytical modules in the modelling platform focused on the transformation towards new data, state of the art methodologies and the use of the most advanced algorithms to optimise decisions, tempos and performance in the Bank‚Äôs new analytical infrastructure.
  • Apply MLOps principles to automate and streamline the model lifecycle, including orchestration, versioning, deployment, and monitoring.
  • Take responsibility to ensure code quality, performance, usability and results are properly managed and maintained to support business objectives.
  • Research and Innovate integrating generative AI technologies to continue to be the spearhead in the sector and drive the modernization of risk management.
  • Structure and synthesise results to provide intuitive metrics and reportings to boost and optimise the decision process.
  • Manage dependencies and risks to ensure the successful implementation of the project.
  • Work, under agile methodology, with multidisciplinary and multicultural teams from Risk, Data, Engineering and Local Units.

    • Experience with big data and analytic tools: Spark and Python is a must.
    • Experience with software development: QA, git, unit testing, copilots
    • Experience with HTML, JS and other web development tools will be valued.
  • Extensive knowledge in Statistical, Machine Learning, GenAI and Optimisation techniques.
  • Knowledge in cloud services (like AWS Sagemaker) and MLOps principles and automation of the model lifecycle, including orchestration, deployment, and monitoring in production environments.
  • Experience with Generative AI technologies (multi-agent, RAG) and their application in improving analytical processes will be highly valuable.
  • With a successful history of defining, developing and managing a software library with value endorsed by stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of credit models (previous experience in model developing or model validation) is a plus.
  • Minimum level of English (B2).
  • Minimum level of Spanish (B2).

We are looking for an enthusiastic individual, who has the following characteristics:

  • Exceptional problem-solving skills and a results-driven mindset.
  • Proven record of leadership in complex projects involving several areas of the organisation.
  • Ability to work collaboratively and effectively with people at all seniority levels.
  • Project management skills. Stakeholder and dependencies management experience is a must.
  • Ability to communicate and explain complex ideas effectively (verbally and in writing), in a simple and clear manner.

Title: Junior Data Scientist - EY wavespace Data & AI hub
Description:
EY wavespace is creating innovative AI technology and products that will transform EY and our clients. The successful candidate will be part of a team building innovative AI solutions that rely on AI and ML techniques including but not limited to natural language processing, computer vision, deep learning, and machine learning.

You will work with:


Explore and try out exciting upcoming libraries, models, technologies to analyze and recommend the best one for the team
Design and implement scalable ML and DL systems, products, and solutions.
Collaborate with engineering and DevOps teams to build and deliver systems that can be deployed both in the cloud and on premise, e.g., using Azure, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Build deep learning-based products on CPUs and GPUs, leveraging latest deep learning and machine learning libraries.
Develop and evaluate data analytics models, algorithms, systems and solutions using a variety of advanced data science techniques
Produces complex predictive models and manages the delivery of solutions which can be used to drive measurable client and commercial benefit
Develops a solid understanding of data structures and business in order to extract and integrate required data sources for analysis


Key Requirements


Excellent programming skills: Experience in languages such as Python
1-2 years of relevant experience
You have experience with both machine learning and building software
You have experience with databases
Machine learning domain knowledge‚Äîbias-variance tradeoff, exploration/exploitation‚Äîand understanding of various model families, including neural net, decision trees, Bayesian models, instance-based learning, association learning, and deep learning algorithms
Good understanding in Deep Learning
Familiarity with Azure cloud ecosystem and OpenAI models
Experience working with large data sets
Excellent problem-solving skills
Strong communication and teamwork
Familiarity with Financial Services
Proficiency in English


Our commitment to diversity & inclusion

We are genuinely passionate about inclusion and we support individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

Title: Applied Research Scientist
Description:
Location: Remote (EU/US friendly time zones) | Full-time




At Alinia AI, we help enterprises in finance, insurance, and healthcare deploy generative AI safely and responsibly. Our platform provides alignment guardrails and compliance monitoring to ensure AI systems are trustworthy.




We are hiring an Applied Research Scientists to play a pivotal role in creating the AI intellectual property and technologies that drive the development of Alinia's Alignment Platform. This role demands a profound understanding of LLMs, their evaluation, and effective alignment with a given set of values and policies.




What you‚Äôll do:

Innovate and refine evaluation methods that assess LLMs along multiple alignment dimensions.
Create robust techniques for synthetic data augmentation to enhance the assessment of LLMs.
Develop streamlined approaches for aligning LLMs through supervised fine-tuning and preference optimization.
Document research projects, progress, and experimentation results and share findings with the broader team.
Work closely with the product development team to transform research insights into actionable AI solutions and strategies for the Alinia Platform.
Keep up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in LLM evaluation, alignment, optimization, and related technologies




What we‚Äôre looking for:

MSc in Computer Science, AI, Linguistics, or a related field.
Proven experience in LLMs, ML, or NLP.
Demonstrated research capability with publications in reputable AI, ethics, or machine learning conferences and journals.
Strong programming skills in Python.
Experience with ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or JAX.




Preferred qualifications:

PhD in Computer Science, AI, Linguistics, or a related field.
Contributions to open-source projects or public datasets in the field of AI.
First-author publications at peer-reviewed AI conferences




Remote | Competitive comp + equity | High-impact role




To apply send your resume to jobs@alinia.ai

Title: AI Engineering Internship
Description:
About The Role

SOPHI is our next gen, once stop concierge we are building to help our online visitors with everything they need!

We are looking for a proactive and detail-oriented SOPHI Program Specialist to join HP‚Äôs Digital Go-To-Market team in Barcelona. This role is central to advancing SOPHI ‚Äî HP‚Äôs proprietary GenAI-powered assistant designed to transform the way customers search, discover, and resolve their needs across our online stores and support channels.

You will play a key role in testing, optimizing, and scaling SOPHI‚Äôs capabilities by ensuring response quality, driving relevancy, and delivering actionable insights from user interactions. You will also help guide the continuous evolution of SOPHI by collaborating cross-functionally and championing AI best practices in this emerging program.

Key Responsibilities

Testing & Automation


Develop and maintain automated and manual testing protocols for SOPHI's response engine
Identify, log, and track failure cases and edge scenarios in conversational flow
Drive regression testing with each new integration or model update


Analytics & Insights


Analyze large datasets from SOPHI interactions to identify pain points, opportunities, and trends
Collaborate with analytics and product teams to derive insights that inform roadmap decisions
Monitor performance KPIs (CTR, CVR, satisfaction scores) and recommend optimization actions


Country & Merchandising Team Engagement


Partner with country sales and merchandising teams to improve regional SOPHI experiences
Localize knowledge base inputs and use case coverage to reflect country-specific customer behavior
Serve as a bridge between business teams and technical teams to align on relevance improvements


AI & Knowledge Base Optimization


Collaborate with DevOps and AI teams to enhance SOPHI‚Äôs knowledge graph and training data
Support integration of new data sources (FAQs, order systems, chat transcripts, promo calendars, etc.)
Ensure SOPHI is continuously learning and evolving based on new content and customer signals


Program Support & Stakeholder Management


Assist with execution of SOPHI roadmap activities (e.g., webchat launch, support use cases, global rollout)
Coordinate with internal stakeholders (e.g., analytics, DevOps, content, localization) for seamless delivery
Act as a key voice in evangelizing SOPHI‚Äôs vision across teams and geographies


Required Qualifications


Currently enrolled on a bachelor‚Äôs or master's degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Business, or related field
Knowledge in AI product testing, digital analytics, or program management roles
Solid understanding of Large Language Models (LLMs), their capabilities, and limitations
Proven ability to work with large datasets using tools like SQL, Python, or equivalent
Experience with GenAI technologies and NLP-driven applications is a strong plus
Strong stakeholder management skills with experience working across global teams
Familiarity with web analytics, A/B testing, and customer journey optimization


Ideal Candidate Profile


Entrepreneurial mindset ‚Äî thrives in ambiguity, self-starter, eager to shape a new program
Growth-oriented ‚Äî always seeking learning opportunities and areas to improve the product
Data-driven ‚Äî passionate about deriving impact from insights
Collaborative ‚Äî able to communicate and partner effectively across technical and non-technical teams
Customer-obsessed ‚Äî motivated by improving end-user experience and relevance


Why Join Us?

You'll be part of an ambitious and fast-moving team shaping the future of customer experience at HP through GenAI. This is a rare opportunity to get in early on a transformative program and help define what excellence looks like in AI-assisted eCommerce and support.

Explore Our Benefits


Curricular or extracurricular Internship agreement between university, company, student
Flexible schedule for part time (4h/day) or full time (8h/day) for a 3 to12 months agreement
A Young employee Network (YEN) which host fun events on a regular basis; such as ‚Äúbeer bust‚Äù Fridays at different venues including the beach in the summertime.
We have an onsite Doctor and medical team for our employees, including services such as: nutrition, physiotherapy and general health
Free daily printing Happy hour ‚Äì from photographs, to large posters. And Hands-on workshops to print with the latest technology ‚Äì from wall covers to 3D printed models

Title: ML Engineer
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

At Planner 5D we are searching for a Senior Python Engineer who will join our team and will be building production-ready systems that directly support our product.

Responsibilities:


Design, build, and maintain scalable services that support the AI lifecycle, working closely with the research team to translate cutting-edge ideas into production-ready solutions
Develop tools for pre/post-processing data for AI and other usage
Develop tools for collecting and processing data
Design scalable pipelines for data collection, processing, and transformation powering next-generation AI systems
Bring new models and features to production at scale with Triton Inference Server, ONNX, and TensorRT
Work across the spectrum from rapid MVPs and experimental prototypes to robust, long-term production-grade solutions
Work closely with ChatGPT API, LangChain



Required knowledge of:


Proficient in Python as the primary language with strong problem-solving and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to design, deploy, and manage scalable backend platforms in production
Understanding Docker and Kubernetes concepts
Practical experience managing challenges throughout the AI/ML lifecycle, from deployment and orchestration to model management
Ability to translate complex business domains into software models using Domain-Driven Design, supported by SOLID and clean coding practices
Ability to adapt quickly, learn new tools, and work independently on complex problems
Computer Science or Math degree
English Intermediate+



Would be a plus:


Experience with algorithms, data structures and graphs
Knowledge of other programming languages (e.g., Kotlin, Java)
Deep experience in mathematics (especially linear algebra), geometry, computer vision
Understanding of 2D / 3D technologies and software (for example OpenGL, WebGL, Raytracing, Blender)



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions



Note: We only consider applications from candidates currently based in locations: Lithuania or Netherlands. Visa sponsorship is available if you hold primary residence with work authorization.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist Trainee
Description:
Mylan, Lda.

At VIATRIS, we see healthcare not as it is but as it should be. We act courageously and are uniquely positioned to be a source of stability in a world of evolving healthcare needs.

Viatris empowers people worldwide to live healthier at every stage of life.

We do so via:

Access ‚Äì Providing high quality trusted medicines regardless of geography or circumstance;

Leadership ‚Äì Advancing sustainable operations and innovative solutions to improve patient health; and

Partnership ‚Äì Leveraging our collective expertise to connect people to products and services.

Our global portfolio includes best-in-class, iconic brand-name products as well as global key brands; generics, including branded and complex generics; and other offerings across a wide range of therapeutic areas. We are committed to helping create healthier communities worldwide through education, outreach and better access to treatment.

For those driven to live their lives with purpose, Viatris helps employees realise their full potential by creating a collaborative culture that fosters courage and resilience. Viatris is more than just a place to work. This is a place to make a difference in the world.

The Role & What You Will Be Doing

The internship program will have a duration of 12 months with the purpose to allow the trainee to have the first approach with the labor market, in the context of a leading multinational pharmaceutical company. The trainee will be able to contact the various processes in Customer Analytics & Insight ‚Äì Digital areas.

Every day, we rise to the challenge to make a difference and here‚Äôs how the Customer Analytics & Insight - Trainee role will make an impact:


Background in Data Analytics for extract, combine, transform and organize different data sets using different sources and languages (SAS, SQL, Excel, VBA, PowerBI, other).
Ability to work with AI & prompt engineering techniques.
Creation, automation, and management reports to support decision making.
Analyze data to answer business questions and to support the continues improvement.
Implementation of new validation processes, data processes and alerts.
Provide visibility on performance activities.
Update reports & dashboards.
Ensure priorities are clear and actioned on.
Ability to prioritize, work cooperatively and collaborate with cross-functional teams in a fast-paced environment.
Proactivity and fast capability to learn.
Communication and person people skills.



About Your Skills & Experience

For this role, we‚Äôre looking for a candidate who has an effective combination of the following qualifications, skills and experiences:


Graduate or Master¬¥s finalists in IT, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Analytics or other relevant area
No experience needed (Preference 1y experience)
Fluency in English
Analytical thinking
Written and oral communication skills
Digital skills and know-how in design, photography and video shutting
Team-working



At Viatris, we are dedicated to building a truly diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt fully align with every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Diversity & Inclusion at Viatris

At Viatris, diversity and inclusion are essential to our mission. The diversity we foster in all aspects of our business can be one of our greatest strengths in redefining healthcare not as it is, but as it should be. If you would like to know more about what diversity, equity and inclusion means to us, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/Careers/Diversity-and-Inclusion

Sustainability at Viatris

Corporate social responsibility is fundamental to the Viatris mission. We work to advance responsible and sustainable operations and leverage our collective expertise to empower people to live healthier at every stage of life, recognizing that our actions affect the stakeholders and communities we serve. To learn more about our efforts, please visit https://www.viatris.com/en/about-us/corporate-responsibility

At Viatris, we offer competitive salaries, benefits and an inclusive environment where you can use your experiences, perspectives and skills to help make an impact on the lives of others.

Viatris is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
